that do not often coagulate in the vessels of the mainstream. kendrick is confident in his raps and he flexes like the archetypal showman james brown marvel at his confidence his audacity to break down the fourth wall thru a spoken word narrative that carries over from one song to the next unconcerned with the sanctity of the other. but despite its overwhelming strengths the poverty lies in its lack of identifiable songs. which is perfectly fine for many a genre of music. but not justifiable here. be avant garde or pop. but do not try to be both. this is aquemini without the payoff. a period piece that gets caught up in its sources and bibliographical references. but even in this artistic pursuit kendrick rattles the cage by sandblasting the vocals into a relegated stratosphere of consciousness so that the idolatry becomes intolerable. never more exemplified than on for free? interlude - boo boo. a grand operatic that hails itself as the victor much like an oscar winning movie made to win an oscar. this is what happens when an mc ego does not get satisfied and curtails the very essence itself. i cannot deny the highlights dollarsthese wallscomplexion and the many bits  pieces of voluptuous sculpted stylings and cacophonies that illuminate this colorfully illustrated work on a whole. i would just rather wade into the source material and its wealth. music that truly was revolutionary and uncompromising. music that was dismissed by a nation gripped by the insidious nature of institutionalized apartheid. but whose water downed themes are finally digestable to a generation today.

um disco bem agressivo no que diz respeito s letras que apresentam uma temtica de orgulho e luta racial como pode-se notar them the blacker the berry i am african-american i am africani am black as the moon heritage of a small villagepardon my residencecame from the bottom of mankindmy hair is nappy my dick is big my nose is round and wideyou hate me do not you?you hate my people your plan is to terminate my culture quanto  sonoridade do disco s vezes ele arrisca umas bases mais jazzsticas e no geral as msicas so boas porm nada que supreenda. e como sempre no acredite no hype.

casting aside contemporary hip hop influences in favor of civil rights movement-era black music foundations why the marriage is not more common is as much a mystery as why they still make banana runts. lamar has hereby received the torch from likely idol gil scott-heron to pen the spiritual soundtrack to the tumultuous black lives matter era of the american sociopolitical climate. and if this is when we truly begin to fall at least the score to national suicide is fitting---our darling poet kendrick a child born out of very real domestic oppression breathes fire over the corpse of this failed grand experiment.

yea kendrick.. sorry guys but i do not think he is as good as you guys make him to be. perhaps this is because i place a stronger importance on the actual rapping and beats over any message but it just fails to hit me on a deeper level. its a good album no doubt but much like its previous i feel that i am really missing out what makes this one so great particular in an era which has released some of my favourite hip hop albums. beatwise its much less commercial and brings a whole lot of jazz and funk beats that would have fitted in the 90s. the beats are definitly the better part of the album. they are perhaps a bit too mellow for the theme of the album but on their own they really provided a great groove. nice rnb hooks here and there as well. the rapping on the other hand is by far the weakest element. i simply do not like his style of rapping in particular when he tries to impersonate other people. its a concept that works out really well if done properly but here i found it to be silly more often than not. his fast rhymes come out flat to me even if some of his lyrics are great when you pay attention to them when shit hits the fan are you still a fan? standsout as one of the strongest. for free though is one of those songs that i cannot see either than being pure shit. hood politics is also pretty annoying. the rest of the release namely the album cover spoken poetry and the interview with 2pac show the huge amount of effort and creativity placed into this album. kendrick lamar surely does not lack ambition. but whatever it is he surely is missing out a vital element for me. something freddie gibbs killer mike and cunninlynguistics have by the loads. its not simply a matter of enjoying slower paced hip hop as i enjoy gangstarr and other like them a lot. overal a very solid album but does not live to the hype for me. standouts are wesleys theory king kunta these walls the blacker the berry and i.

in summary kendrick thinks a lot about things. the current state of hip-hop his role of life in compton and comptons role of life in him life after fame racial tensions in the you.s. post-ferguson just to name a few. the problem is kendrick does not seem to be draw any insightful or original thoughts about any of these topics. as such kendrick is at his best when he is simply trying to speak his heart rather than preach his mind.

kendrick lamar is an artist who has been able to break into the mainstream in the same way that eminem did he releases challenging emotionally charged albums. whereas eminem was more offensive thus making his message a little harder to decipher without careful listening lamar is challenging in a different way. the difficulty for to pimp a butterfly and the reason why it is necessary to listen to it a few times is that it is conceptually daring. instead of going down the same road as his previous album the critically acclaimed and beloved good kid m.a.a.d city lamar has embraced jazz funk and neo-soul. free jazz is known for utilizing constant chord changes and the chaotic nature is an effort to return jazz to its more primal form. it was a movement developed due to anger towards where conventional jazz has gone and to pimp a butterfly -- which is a terrible title but do not be fooled by it -- has more than one thing in common with that genre. the most obvious similarity that it has with jazz is the fact that it relies heavily on it. generally the instrument work behind lamar is the most interesting part of the album. it shifts and organically moves heavy on saxophone and experimentation. it is very rewarding when a jazzy beat slowly creeps into the music and compliments his words perfectly. it is not limited to jazz because there are times when a more upbeat and probably more radio-friendly beat will kick in. some of this is married with neo-soul guitar and these songs are the closest to being singles because most of the album is not set up for mass consumption. in all honesty this could have been released as a strictly-instrumental album and would have succeeded admirably. it is obvious that lamar is more conscious of concepts than most rappers working today because to pimp a butterfly is an example of a record that lives and dies by it. this is not merely a collection of songs as most of them bleed into one another and there is a clear motif here. the way the sound traverses from genre to genre also reeks of free jazz because he is not interested in making a rap album that sounds like every other one. it is not always easy to get into it but it can be immensely fulfilling once you have. he sometimes repeats lines such as a spoken word section that creeps its way in at the end of multiple songs slowly unfolding to tell a full story. i am not always a fan of this particular element because it feels unnecessary to get his point across. it can sometimes kill the momentum going into the next song when i hear a bunch of lines that i have already heard multiple times. they are poetic incredibly personal and good by themselves but repetition kills the meaning. this culminates in a final twelve minute track mortal man that sounds like a normal song until the final half -- then it brings tupac back from the dead in an interview between teacher and student lamar asking him questions and using samples to answer them. this is a a controversial decision not in a shocking way but because some people think it is perfect and others -- like me -- think it is a little cheesy. when i heard that it existed i was eager to listen but it left me cold. it is just a novelty but it does fit within the confides of the concept running through the album. i am glad i did not write a review after my initial listen though because i felt like there was too much spoken word. it can be used to enhance an experience but overindulgence in it can kill the pace of an album. it is one thing to have a record that is entirely spoken word then it is another to give listeners one thing only to take it away. they become parts that i would cut out once it is ripped to my computer. luckily on repeated listens i realized that it does not suffocate the album. sometimes they do as intended but other times they do not. this is an angry record. it is overtly personal this time around but he also takes aim at social injustices. he is deeply affected by police brutality and the plights of his people. it is never hard to understand what he is saying but it does it with a complexity that never obscures the message. he is a very talented mc and a man who can go from more simplistic rhymes to multis in an instant. he invokes and deals with his demons using a variety of voices. this results in his message usually being intensified but occasionally it holds it back. many have complimented you for him sobbing throughout but it just feels forced to me. other times it is absolutely a positive thing. take for free? interlude for example it is a song that his voice gets steadily higher at the end as he spits some of his most inspired stuff over a really delicious jazz freakout. i am a big proponent of mcs who do not say lines with the same boring bland delivery. lamar does it well for the most part but there are just a few moments where it becomes too much. still i would rather he do that and fail than be just another rapper. at the very least songs stick out in that regard. i do not feel the same love for to pimp a butterfly as i am seeing from most people around the internet but i think lamar is an artist we need in the public conscious. my problem with him particularly on this album is that he sometimes overstuffs the concepts. this leads to some weird creative urges that he ends up following to his detriment. if these inferior sections were small that would be great but this can lead to a good ten or fifteen minutes of music that should not be there. even so the other hour of music is an intelligent example of a genre that at least in the mainstream is criminally dishonoured by uninspired crap.
kendricks arty tendencies work better in his production choices and flows than in poetry or avant structures. his al tv style interview with tupac is an absurd trifle.
the revolution will be televised and brought to you by reebok.
its ok but holy shit is it way too long. this could be easily reduced to half it is actually running time without losing much of the story. 510

a completely pedestrian work. the groundwork is bland melodies that no one could make appear anything but amateurish thus shields  co. decided to cleverly hide them amidst loud and irritating drone some cardboard drums and vocalists so bad i seriously cannot fathom why anyone ever thought it was a good idea to record them. now i obviously do not oppose the concept itself given my well-established love for the jesus  mary chain but i feel there is a fundamental difference between the bands while jamc worked noise into songs taking ear-piercing white noise as something to work with harmonically mbv layer chunks of coarse not-quite-so-white noise over their subpar britpop trifles of songs. the result is not hypnotising haunting dreamy or whatever vague adjective you choose to apply to me it all sounds rather morose. the work of a band who dabbled in pop music and understandably decided it was not their forte choosing to expand their half-formed songs to crude noisy jams that certainly do not sound like quarter a million pounds was spent on them. it is lifeless anemic and essentially boring.

as a very regular user of rym loveless became more and more difficult to avoid. an album released in 1991 and in the top fifty albums of all-time? well i just had to discover listen and review. there are many very highly rated albums which i enjoy but i do not understand quite why the adulation is so intense see for example kid a and spirit of eden. and i am now adding loveless to this list. perhaps the sound and style of this album was influential let us agree that the grinding guitars are cool and well backed by understated percussion and keyboards. but there are no words to enjoy the vocals are very restrained and for me this is a collection of cool riffs and sounds rather than something to thrill. yes yes yes i am probably completely missing the point but from an entertainment point of view my best offer is 3.5. key track when you sleep

music that people who are in the transition phase from emo to hipster listen to. that being said i actually like this album. it is messed up in a beautiful way. if that makes any sense. which it does not.

while there are many loose precedents for the dreamy langorous lysergic sweet fuzzy warbly sound on this album from the 60s sounds of mandrake memorial to the 80s sounds of sonic youth it is a great achievement of innovation with guitar timbre and texture a thick yet watery and fractured sound. combined with warm melodies and easy-going grooves these complex textures give great comfort and joy to the people who got hooked on this sound during their tender years. while i am not really a big fan of this 90s shoegaze sound i find it quite enjoyable and i can hear how it lives up to its titanic reputation actually ranked 18 of all-time on rym curiously far ahead of any soft machine fairport convention or you.s. maple album.

music is pretty much like the album cover generic crap with layers of effects to hide the weaknesses but they manage to hide it very well and turn it into feel good inoffensive but quite monotonous background music. enjoyable in fairly small doses but forgettable.

i figure that i should do myself a favour and listen to as many of ryms top rated albums as possible. so without knowing much about this at all i took the decision to listen to loveless. usually i will listen to an album at least 3 times before i review it. for this one i will make an exception because honestly i really could not be bothered to listen more than once. i have read the reviews positive and negative. it is fuzzy and swirling and maybe a bit hypnotic. there is also a lot of repetitive noise. there is no rhythm or melody. maybe it would sound good if i was on some drug induced high but that is not going to happen and this is therefore just a pointless waste of my time. it is staggering how many people think this is a masterpiece. i must be crazy for not agreeing right? well i am pretty sure i am not the crazy one!

see i can see the quality and the emotional power this album has really is deserving of all the accolades it is had. it is really fucking good. but it is not my album yknow? it never said that much at all to me. also can we talk about how silly everyone in this band had such silly names? they did!

bumped from january 21 2011 so i am standing here next to one of the most highly acclaimed indie albums of all time and ask why? and like a self-righteous celebrity built on ego you just push me to the side. you have many fans mr. celebrity and they like you but it is as if you do not like them back. numerous reviews of people rating 5 stars and just saying one-liners though in their defense the negative reviews are hardly any better... well i sir need to stand to you on that. okay you developed a sound consisting of a fuzz wall of armor but submerged within the layers brims with a neon luminescent aquatic life... or so they say. so i am on only shallow and a mechanical array baffles you before opening its doors to its true melodies awhile before it is walls close it to give it its true shoegaze prowess. going in deeper and deeper into the album it is all you are going to get from you. slow to mid tempos relying on a subtle noise and concealing a melody inside. this all goes on and i emphasize this with very little differentiation that is often the key to helping reignite some spark on albums that drift away from my attention. now many people do not get this album from only the bombardment standpoint of the unfriendly to some wall of sound. now the wall of sound is okay i get that it is part of the art but the problem here is that its just been done better after-time or before. bridging my review is this summary walls of sound do not annoy me but this album bothers me from the outside and in the inside. of course people might ask you to look underneath but even then the melodies excavated from these layers just are 100 drab forgettable and a wandering waste of my time get bored my back hurts and whatever grumpy old man thing i can think of from this 20 year old brain. and it does not help being atmospheric either because that is where the wall of sound takes such a thing away. it is between a rock and a hard place too calm to be driven by it and too obstructing to be soothing. let me put it to you this way you eat a chocolate bar and it tastes unappealing. just as you are about to throw it away some person comes up and tells you that there is a creamy irresistible nougat in the center. so of curiosity you get to bite the center only to discover that the nougat is also unappealing. that sums up what loveless is to me unappealing hiding inside more unappealing. you probably need weed to enjoy this to summarize but true music is let loose without the aid of skeptical alterations. i do not hate shoegaze in its entity and i might not like chapterhouse so much either but the reason i still prefer them is that they can actually write appealing melodies from time to time and does not sound like they are bored out of their skulls while maintaining a shoegaze sound. such an overrated album really probably the most overrated album i ever listened to but what can you expect that the big-dicked critics like pitchfork must lay down the hammer that this is perfect music and everyone must insist on investing into those words. i am not trying to make this a when everyone goes left i go right case but it frustrates me how critics can have such control over music. 4.710 ---poor

je suis mal  laise et je ne me dbrouille pas bien sous linfluence gnante des impasses et des circonstances limites. je suis frle et jai besoin dun soutien pour maider  survivre  la vie et  conqurir la tragdie. la tristesse je vous connais trs bien  je me souviens une soire particulire chez les bretons sans inquiet et sans froideur au milieu dun t o le soir mlait  la nuit o tre  lextrieur sous les toiles et auprs dun amour tait le plus grand plaisir. jai tenu une main forte et pourtant douce et jai ternellement rv. cela narrive gure sans fin invitable et je ne sais pas si je veux le trouver encore aprs avoir t laiss tout seul mais real adventures do not happen to people who remain at home they must be sought abroad. daprs james joyce. cest la fuite de la patrie de la banalit et des humaines veules mais cest un bonheur phmre. je suis bless et jy ai pleur la premire fois depuis mon enfance. par peut me panser mais dieu ne peut mme me gurir. cest une misre certaine pour ceux qui osent se tenir debout et essaient de trouver le sens de la vie. je ne comprends pas tout le monde et je ne sais pas tous les faits mais du moins je connais bien moi-mme.

there must be some secret way to enjoy this album that i have not been let in on. to the nake eye it is just a bunch of droning noises that do not even sound that great and do not change the least bit for often at least a minute. as for the vocals they sound nice but they do not change notes and can barely been heard. one of the biggest letdowns i have ever experienced. edit listened to it again to give it a second chance becuase of thier new album and i actually liked some of the songs especially the last song. there were a couple of songs i did not like though to be honest. i guess shoegaze is not my thing
the whole wall of sound is pretty chintzy and trebly. the guitars are not too noisy and the rhythm section is amateurish and the vocals trifling. despite some decent guitar tones it is terribly dull.

loveless produces a sound just as fuzzy as the cover and in the process creates a very good album that is deserving of some praise but not the amount rym has given it. the sound and production is revolutionary and after sorting through the fuzz there is some brilliant work being done on the production end that justifies the year long recording periord. i would give this album a higher rating if some tracks were tighter and did not repeat a loop of sound for the last minute of the track. the most notorious offenders are i only said and to here knows when which were they shorter would add another half star. unlike most reviewers trying to poke holes in loveless i do not mind the vocal quality and find it soothing and do not get hung up on whether or not i can discern the lyrics. after giving it several listens i feel as though loveless is the sort of album that you need to hear at the right time and place in your life to be blown away by it. even taking it out of the aforementioned scenario loveless is an intriguing amusing but short of enthralling record that is worth a listen if only for its unique sound. favorites only shallow loomer sometimes
loveless is pleasant. loveless is ground-breaking. loveless is overrated.
trying to make out the details behind this loud fucking noise-core.
ouch! approved with the headphonical seal of utter crap torture soundscapes

am i the only one on this site with enough balls to admit that i just do not get this? people hail this as amazing yet all i hear are some pleasant fuzzy melodies layered in a thick coating of warm noise. sure this is not bad at all quite nice actually but is it worthy of being at this point in time the 28th best record of all time? hell no. more often than not this album gets both annoying and boring although there are many decent enough moments to make up for it. most of the songs blend into each other except for sometimes which is a song i want to make sweet sweet sweet love to. sonically. look if you want to read a negative review then go to the negative reviews section and if you want to hear a positive review then go to the positive reviews section. this review cannot say anything that has not been said about this album before besides from the fact that it is all just somewhat pleasant noise. all you hipsters should stop fucking fooling everyone and yourselves and just admit that you do not really get this album and the only reason you pretend that you do is because it makes you trendy. there i said what was needed to be said.
pointless

i will get the highlights out of the way now... these are essentially the least god-awful songs on the cd when you sleep sometimes loveless essentially amounts to the emperors new clothes of all music. there is not a single good piece of music on the entire record yet it sucks orgasms out of disillusioned listeners like some coked-out anna nicole smith at a glory hole. how this degenerate piece of garbage acheived such fanboy status in the first place is inexplicable it is only certain that the illusion by mere existence perpetuates itself. loveless was supposed to be one of the defining albums of the 90s the quintessential shoegaze album if you will. in attempting to listen to it though it is hard for any serious music lover not to resort to ad hominem attacks at the sheer pointlessness of it or on the other hand discard it entirely. in that light i am guessing that if more listeners were of the former category it would have a far lower rating. but enough about the hype. on to the music. to start off the vocals are overwhelmed by talentless scarcely melodic cacophonous noises without even minimal percussion cement it all together i know i get it it is supposed to be minimalistic right? the reason for the inaudible vocals is because if one could actually here the lyrics being sung then one would realize how unbelievably bad and thoughtless the lyrics actually are. prepubescent wannabe poet being cruelly encouraged by his instructors to continue the therapeutic writing even though it is complete shit and everyone knows it. then there are the horrible horribe sounds. i think some of them are guitars but it is hard to tell they are all muddled together in one massive heap. well there is not much past the sounds. that is pretty much what this album is regardless of whether you want to add a lyrical spin to it or not. unique in this instance is a bad thing. just because you can do something does not mean you should. i could record myself taking a piss the floor for instance but it would be a waste of my time and everyone elses. that all being said do yourself a favor and do not listen to this crap. and if you do have the decency to call it like it is a piss-dripping mangled and dangling dick with nothing to cover it up.
concept album. about foot pedals and such.

well what can i say? i have a funny feeling that this album would probably sound pretty good if you would ingested some mushroom soup before hand and i am not talkin heinz variety here do not get me wrong i have taken plenty of trips myself and much farther than brighton i can tell you but in the cold light of day i am afraid this one really is hard work to listen to. so for now at least it receives the lowest mark in my collection. maybe one day i will dust it down and give it another go but with so much other stuff out there vying for my attention and screaming to be listened to i doubt whether this albums second chance will come any time soon.

you know there is nothing more boring than some dick on the internet giving a low rating to a much loved classic album and writing a long overwrought review explaining how he is right dammit and all you all sheeple are dead wrong. i would rather read through all the 0.5 star reviews of 808s and heartbreak lol south park quote fagot than do one of those. plus i already kind of did that for 3 feet high and rising. but this album i just do not get. i am not trying to make some kind of point - i just find it disappointing considering it is meant to be pet soundz for the 90s yo! and such. i dug their previous cd it is got some awesome tunes on it and a nice dreamy overall quality. this one though has a dreamy sick quality without any of the awesome tunes. i do not know. i guess i just do not have the right appreciation for noise as a genre. i will stick with with their first album. i do encourage everyone to check it out because as much as i dislike it i somehow doubt i will ever hear another album quite like it.

not a bad album but hardly the earth-shattering experience that many claim it to be. not much in the way of songwriting and the execution is fairly pedestrian. it does succeed in establishing a decent atmospheric feel but that is not enough to make this otherwise somewhat amateurish album anything special.

after initial hearings i gave this noise classic 1 12 stars assuming its genius would later dawn on me. instead i found it was giving my other 1 12s a bad name so i took it out of the homeless shelter and handed it back to the department of corrections.

bloody awful. actually there is a good album beneath all the horrific droning. if i had some sort of audio editing software on my computer i could probably cobble together a nice 4 star album out of this. however as it stands this is perhaps the most annoying album i have ever heard. it sounds like it was recorded inside a beehive. do not play this album if you have a dog it will be pure torture for the poor creature. along with the stone roses it is a late 80searly 90s british release generally considered brilliant which just makes me wonder what the hell other people are hearing.

i have no problems at all with loveless no problems with people who lavish praise on it. but there are songs that rise above songs that because me problems when people say this whole album is perfect. well thee first n last tracks because more of a mental stir no matter how layered thee middle 9 are. only shallow has that buried riff which is also instantly memorable. my first time hearing this ditty is it ok to call an art-song like this a ditty? was probably just like thee first time so many devotees heard it but it was intense anyhow. agreeable n slicing it deserves to be played at each volume setting on yr stereo to reveal thee full range that is shoegazers mastery.  soon well that song is what i compare all other lengthy noise pop songs to. it contains that emergence from lo-fi dance drums into a fuzz rock spectacle with hallucination inducing background vocals.  more of course. this runs deep.
pretty music but there is not a whole lot here.

picked this up after reading all the glowing reviews on this site. this is noise pop. and dreary noise pop too. i prefer music. if you want to immerse yourself in immelodious noise driven by overloud droning guitars accompanied by feedback and barely audible vocals then enjoy!. occasionally a jolly little hook surfaces momentarily to be swallowed up by the sea of noise. i have listened to this repeatedly over several months and i still cannot find any high points to be positive about. sometimes is probably the most listenable track. it is not one that will be getting much play time in my life.

i once owed this album.i think it was the first song or second on the record that i liked that prompted me to pay cash for the album in hopes of joyful noise.then i played the other songs and carefully listened.i took the record off.i played it about two months later.i looked at my feet.i put my feet in motion.i went to the record store that gave me money for used records.i exchanged it for cash.i then went taco casa and bought me a burrito boat.yummmmmcheese and beef.

do you ever feel like you have picked up a different album to the one everybody else has? gang of fours entertainment! the pixies doolittle jamcs psychocandy and this album are all releases that get praised to the heavens. all of them have been recommended to me by people who is opinions i respect some of whom are almost as intelligent as myself. all of them turned out to be faintly boring. what gives? we all know electric guitars can be exciting dynamic instruments. most of us know just how cool feedback can be some of us love the visceral thrill of a noise overload. this album has layers of guitar noise feedback echoing throughout with glorious lush melodies and pop sensibilities underneath. or so the official line goes. on the cd i picked up there is a rather dull droning noise like someone doing their vacuum cleaning in an echo chamber. that dull turgid drone continues throughout the album. the lush melodies underneath turn out to be the cranberries pissing about with a bunch of demos the cocteau twins threw away in disgust. honestly this record is typical nme approved dull indie rock with a meandering drone played over the top. it is about as original as the next oasis album and as exciting as a heavy stereo comeback tour. it is not awful it is just kind of there in the same way that traffic noise is there. you just would not rate it 5 stars.

possibly the most annoying record i have ever heard. the dissonant wall of sound and sickly sweet vocals just does not do it for me. nowhere are any progressions to be found in the music - only repetitive chords banging over and over chords filtered through so much noise and fuzz that extended listening induces migraines. little wonder then that robert christgau was all over this album but even then he admits that he hated it at first but it was only after suitable suffering and peer support i learned. yep kind of indicates that this is just hipster bullshit. as far as shoegaze goes while these bands are not pure shoegaze give me the smashing pumpkins anyday over this tripe or even the silversun pickups album from a couple years back - at least they have decent melodies and good drumming none of this drum loop and sample rubbish. and what is more i am sure virtually every hipster here would praise the juxtaposition of ugly dissonace and nice melodies of this record saying that it is a one of a kind record and at the same time dismiss other music styles such as death metal which does the whole beautiful but punishing thing a million times better. but whatever ignorance is bliss right? unrated  0100

i never saw mbv back in my formative years even though many of my old friends went at least partially deaf at their shows. as far as pioneering shoegazers go i much prefer lush. i can appreciate this album for the atmosphere it creates and its production values but it is so obvious mbv want to be a pop band. if they would written more stuff like to here knows when their rep would be more deserving but they stuck to form rather than content. anyway noise - melodic dissonant whatever - was hardly a new concept in 1991. thing is they do not write any other fully formed noteworthy tunes despite kevin shields fucking around with his pedals most of the time. i do not really understand the gushing accolades this receives.

it is good not thaaaaat good though. not wanting to get all controversial or owt but nowt as great as you made me realise. oooooh it came out on my birthday. i bought it on the day and was possibly drunk i would imagine....what with it being my birthday. not the infamous ace of spades birthday of 89. never been the same since you know!

more than anything else i have heard loveless works as a complete album rather than a random collection of songs. in other words it has a fantastic flow. the album starts with only shallow which is not noisey so much as it is fuzzy. it is got an electric hook that the whole band mimics. it is hard to describe just how together it sounds but it sounds like the look of a very unified rapid i.e. a roaring river that flows up and down and over little waterfalls all in one direction. cutting through this river is are the super compressed drums which provide fills that sound more like something is going off than being hit. interestingly only shallow is the only song that has that level of impact. loomer and touched are forgettable. to here knows when is just noise ambient. it is alright. loveless only slightly recovers on when you sleep with its dreamy lead synth hook it almost sounds like a gentle organ which shows up at times. i only said has a similarly tasty hook but it is a bit noisier. here more than anywhere else on loveless or is not anything the lyrics are utterly unintelligible. the vocals are just a melody instrument. then things get back to more ambient fuzz again before what you want provides the albums first noisey-as-in-a-little-painful sound making it the first track that does not simply work as a good atmosphere piece. i cannot help but with that this track came after come in alone because after 8 tracks the harshness of what you want is a little much for my fatigued ears. besides this one gripe the album flows miraculously with the songs going from hook-y to atmospheric to hook-y and then back to atmospheric. it is a kind of dynamic that albums rarely work with and so even if few songs are outstanding the whole thing comes together for a pretty good experience.
espetacular

so much noise i cannot even hear them sing over all the instruments and if i can hear them its harder to understand than a 2-year-old kid then only good track is when you sleep because of the riff on it maybe i need to wait 5 more years until i can really understand or maybe it is too deep for me right now like i really do not get it so in 5 years i might come back

i have never been able to appreciate this album. despite it is status as the greatest shoegaze album of all time i would much rather give that accolade to you know what- glitter by pasteboard that is right. why the shocked face? oh i suppose souvlaki deserves an honorable mention. loveless is an album with a bit too much noise pop and not enough dream pop in my humble opinion. it actually wears on my ears after a fashion- this coming from someone who enjoys raw black metal. the guitar tone is beyond mere fuzzy sometimes it sounds like churning gravel for gods sake. now we need to discuss the whining reverb i cannot help but wince every time the reverb hits a peak. sometimes is a great song other than that i do not know what to tell you.

loveless is an album with a heavyweight reputation behind it so much so that i must admit i have spent the last two decades being both intrigued and wary of it. it is an album whose place in the grand scheme of influential rock albums is assured regardless of it being a cult favourite rather than a best seller. it is one of those albums appreciated by those who take their music very seriously. perhaps a little too seriously. loveless is an album that took the band who created it over two decades to follow up simply because it was almost impossible to top. the more i listen to loveless the more i realise that it is an album you listen to for how it makes you feel rather than the actual songs and how it makes you feel is as unique as the individual listening to it. for example the first time i listened to loveless in full was when i was going for a walk on the first day of starting a new job so it made me fell warm slightly buzzing full of trepidation but undeniably excited. now i am pretty sure that is not the emotional headspace that my bloody valentine had in mind when they were creating loveless but every time i listen to it it gives me those same feelings. musically yeah loveless is what i was anticipating. lots of distorted guitars and a genuine feeling of distance and space. now i would usually grumble about a vocals being buried far too deep in the mix but bilinda butchers vocals are exactly where they need to be in fact the whole sound of the album is something i could only describe is meticulously organised chaos which now i have done a bit of research into the agonising lengths that band went into creating loveless may not be too far from the mark. i say band but there is various claims that kevin shields played every note of music himself with butcher handling the vocals and an immense amount time was spent trying to master the studio technology and switching around various engineers to get the exact sound that shields wanted. apparently such efforts almost bankrupted their record label. perhaps inevitably loveless is an album i need to be in the mood for and while i am not in that mood very often when i am it is the only album i reach for. it was the unarguable apex of the arty shoegaze sound and carries with it the sort of cool cachet that means it is an album that subsequent generations will gravitate to in much the same way as they gravitate to the velvet underground  nico or forever changes so it seems that its reputation among those who take their music seriously is unlikely to dwindle at any point in the foreseeable future.

do not get me wrong i still really like most of what loveless has to offer but it is definitely not the holy grail end all be all shoegaze album that 99 of people on this site say it is. compared to similar albums such as slowdives souvlaki i find the songwriting and general instrumentation of loveless to be inferior. while i would consider this to be a great listen it is a little annoying that a few of the songs are not mixed as well as the others. especially to here knows when as the guitar and vocals completely overpower the drums. do not even get me started on touched. it is such a stupid sounding song that serves no purpose to the album but to be skipped over every time. i wonder what kind of drugs colm ociosoig was on when he made it. while this is far from being a perfect and flawless album it redeems itself by having a handful of great and enjoyable tracks.

just plain old noisy and dreamy pink is my fave color does not understand the concept of sex but gets sex anyway happy but also in pain absolutely celebrated loveless. okay fine i do not hate it that much i am more with the crowd that says that it is a fine piece of shoegaze... but as a seminal album in all points maybe??? what clicks to most people is that the whole sound of the record is that it is ethereal and soothing but i picture it as... just noise i do not know. it is hard trying to sum up words for albums you just think are in a spot of being good but could not fully get what the hype is all about but i had to make due to listen to it because i knew there was some fruition with it. i could vibe with a band that uses the whammy bar a bit more if they made that could be comprehensive to my psyche then again that would sound better or worse depending on many things if you think that this albums chaos is already enough but long story short i just think that it is alright. i am not dissing anybody who likes this or the shoegaze crowd in general i just think that this is good for what it stands for and i can understand what it is aiming... i just.... reaallly had a tough time putting it all together.

take some mediocre songwriting and throw a bunch of effects over this music and you get something that sounds like this. i do not really see the appeal of this album other than maybe the vibe it gives off.

i never used to like this album. i do not really like any of the shoegaze classics. but last night i was rewatching lost in translation with my girlfriend and in this one scene a song was playing that we both thought was cool so we shazamed it. the song was sometimes and i was kind of shocked because i did not remember enjoying any other track off of this album apart from when you sleep but this one sounded really cool and it made me want to go back and give the album another go. and going back to loveless i was even more shocked to find that i actually like it. during the first four tracks i was dreading that it was going to suck just as much as it did the first few times around but then once you get to when you sleep the rest of the album is really enjoyable. still nowhere near as good as most make it out to be but i am learning to appreciate loveless more and more. maybe one day i will be able to say that i love it.

alright so straight out of the bat this album makes my head hurt like crazy. i had to take a break at the halfway point. track ratings 1. only shallow 9.510 - easily the best song on here. the intro is the best part of the album i just love the way it comes in so loudly. the vocals are very fitting to the song. 2. loomer 510 - a very boring filler song. the vocals are very annoying and guitar is way too messy. 3. touched 310 - i know it is under a minute long but it really gets under my skin. it is just so obnoxious. 4. to here knows when 110 - what the fuck is this? sounds like a very shitty demo recorded on a old nokia that has just been taken out of water. 5. when you sleep 910 - a fantastic song that was obviously intended to be a hit. gorgeous riff and vocals. 6. i only said 710 - the guitar is obviously great so is the synth melody but i do not like the vocals at all. also this song gave me the biggest headache. 7. come in alone 7.510 - great riff decent vocals - nothing more to say. 8. sometimes 8.510 - this ones very good. the way the acoustic and electric guitar collide with eachother is phenomenal. 9. blown a wish 6.510 - wasted potential. the beginning melody is very pleasant but sadly the vocals completely ruin it. the chorus i do not know if you can call it that is extremely annoying. 10. what you want 7.510 - i would give this one an 8 if it was a minute and a half shorter take a minute off the actual songa nd 30 seconds of the outro. nothing else to pick on though. 11. soon 910 - very suprised with how much i liked this one. very catchy melody and it is probably the most calm song on here. vocals are passable which is good enough for mbv. score 6.710 final verdict had potential to be better than it is. some songs are the peak of 90s alternative rock music other are just boring and sometimes even unlistenable to here knows when. the most criminal thing however is the production. it is no exacuration fucking abysmal. the drums are hard to hear in over half of the tracks which is a shame because it could easily bump up the some ratings only shallow would be a 10. also where is the bass? i do see the appeal of this record but guys come on. 6 album of all time???

i already listened to loveless once but i remember absolutely nothing about it. so today i decided to relisten which i did not even have the urge to do and it did not change my mind on anything. its not like this album is bad or anything but it is not anything memorable for me. there is way too many god damn effects on everything that i cannot hear what is going on. that also brings me to my 2nd problem with the album is that everything feels sluggish leading the album to feel twice as long as it already is. again the album is bad and i even like some aspects of this but as an overall experience it does nothing for me. i garuntee you that i am going to forget most of this album when i am done listening

another case of i do not get it. yknow whenever i listen to something that critically acclaimed and then really do not like it i feel kind of stupid and like i am missing out. well that is exactly what happened here. there are not really redeeming qualities about this album that would justify giving any higher rating for me and i am seriously baffled about how this got to the place it is in but i guess i can appreciate it for what it is. i can imagine having this in the background for whatever but overall it just seems uninteresting lyrically as much as sonically. i have heard worse but this just is not for me.

this album just does not click for me. it is clearly technically fantastic and sonically beautiful but it feels off like it is lacking soul. the faults i find in this album if any are not really faults but just a feeling  a lack of love that i think should be there. compared to souvlaki the other famous shoegaze album it does not achieve the same emotional poignancy or indeed the same emotional anything. the track touched came the closest with its trippy aesthetics sounding like part of a vaporwave record but being less than a minute long it was not enough. maybe i am missing something perhaps it is better while on drugs or on a car ride or perhaps live but right now i cannot sense the greatness. all things considered this album is truly awesome but i really wish it could evoke some sort of emotion. best tracks only shallow loomer touched to here knows when worst tracks come in alone sometimes

i like shoegaze so this is not an example of an album not being for me. simply put it is not a good album. although there is a couple of redeeming moments for the most part it is filled with uninteresting melodies that tire out after the first 20 seconds of the song or are simply just not good. 410
loveless would benefit immensely from heavier production a la red house painters down colourful hill strong 7 to a light 8

i listened to this album a few times and i can never get why this site adores this album. sure it has the merit of being one of the most influential albums ever recorded but it is not really my cup of tea. if they did not drown the vocals under the instruments i am sure i would like it much more but then it loses the thing that made it so unique. only shallow is my favorite song here and i can see why soon gets the reputation as one of the most revolutionary pop songs.

part 2 of dropping a lot of money on albums i am not a huge fan of. this time it is a pretty big one. i do not know if i should keep this brief or go off on a rant guess i will see. i will start by talking about it in relation to the previous album an album i thought was bad is not anything. this album is much more focused it uses the noisiness in a much more direct effective way. paired with that the vocals are actually on-key this time they do help in making that ethereal sound and feeling that these guys are known for. there is a lot more structure throughout and there is not too much here that feels amateurish there is genuinely good use of the heavy effects. i mean from the very first moment that is evident on only shallow with that infamous beginning the wall of noise that just slaps you in the face. from there you have loomer which is another track that i enjoy quite a lot. however it stops here. from here until soon there is not much i find interesting. all the ideas that this album has are pretty much expended by the end of the first two tracks. from the walls of noise heavier ethereal moments more vocals weird moments like the end of the first track it is all found in these first two tracks. so from here everything just became this one noise that was quite similar bouncing from one to the other feeling like nothing but the same. the transitions kind suck too like from touched to to here knows when it almost makes the interlude track feel totally redundant the way it is done so sloppily. the rest of the album follows suit treading this line of listenable yet boring if not because of a lack of ideas then because of a lack of emotion. i did enjoy soon quite a bit i found it to have a slightly more solid set of ideas that it managed to execute luckily there was at least that. again as i said for the previous album it feels as if the noise is being used as a means to cover something up except this time it is not lack of musical ability i think this time it is a lack of song writing ability. i struggle to believe an album like this almost caused bankruptcy. rating  5-5.510

. hello. my name is cold in eden and i want to write a review for my bloody valentines album loveless. i have never understood why this shit is so highly rated. shoegaze is fucking overrated post-punk is overrated and this shit is just plain stupid. i am going to start off by saying that the vocals are pretty good on here. the singer sounds like she could be in a band or something. however her voice does not really carry the song. it is not bad per say but it is not anything special either. also i do not understand why it is ranked  5 on the rateyourmusic site. what the fuck? that site is filled with shit and i do not even trust it. they have got radiohead at the 1 rank that is pretty fucking stupid considering how overrated that band is. wall of sound production on this thing is pretty damn stupid too. guitar tone 210. generic boring and very predictable. i can hear the same thing in every emo bands music after a while. the same tremolo picking is used for the rhythm parts too. rhythm 710. generic drumming pattern will not bore you and the bassist follows it pretty accurately most of the time. i do not like the fact that they always use a 74 time signature though. it is fucking cheesy. bass 810. good job. drums 510. generic as hell but they do the job. vocals 710. cannot really add anything else to this part. they are not bad and they fit the music well enough. my bloody valentine in my opinion could have done better. every single song on here could have been 3-4 minutes long and it would not have hurt anything. there really is nothing special here at all and it could have easily been a half hour long and still been shit. despite this i do find some things attractive about this album. it is raw but that is mainly appealing to people who enjoy bad production and amateur sounding stuff. the guitar tone is just horrible but that is not really something you can fix. as for the shoegaze elements they are there but i cannot say i am a fan of it. it is not bad enough to hate it though so there is that. overall 6.510 better than most releases but still pretty mediocre. i would say this is worth at least a few listens but after that it is not much more to it. thanks for reading.

this album is not good. the juxtaposition of sentimentality and harshness only meshes on a few songs such as to here knows when and maybe two other songs. good ideas do not mean good execution. this sounds like less noisy and interesting spacemen 3 for dumb teenagers who need to cling onto some messy half-baked form of nostalgic emotions. the music itself is not bad but it is not as innovative as people make it out to be. this is one of the few albums where its reputation hurts it as it sets up high expectations and then delivers mediocrity lowering it a star. unbias be damned.

bad mixing? i could not hear the vocals at all the instruments are too loud. it sounds like the guy hums random words through a loud so forward in the mix guitar that is effected so much. what does this mean? i have so many questions about this could this just be another album with a gimmick?

something that has always got me has been the claim that for anyone wanting to get into schoegaze music this is the album for it. it is labelled as a benchmark and even one of the best albums of the 90s. off the top of my head i can name 10 albums that dropped in 1991 alone that are better than this. atmospherics should not be the only factor when evaluating this record. like most people rightfully argue that the majority of edm is repetitive my bloody valentine has seriously committed this cardinal sin with this release. where the cloudiness comes in quite beautifully like on only shallow or when you sleep. both of which are blissful and euphoric in the best possible way. the rest of the album continues to get more and more cloudy throughout till you are left in a confusing and boring fog. loomer and sometimes are thick condensed shoegaze tracks that almost feel like attempts to recreate some tracks from the jesus and mary chains psychocandy. but with overbearing production and no direction. and touched if i may touch just briefly on it is a 56 second waste of breath. if you can keep your focus to the end of the album you will be treated to a rather spectacular end with the cut soon. at almost 7 minutes long it is hypnotic and winds what themes they were trying to incorporate together very well. loveless tricks you into thinking there is more there than there really is. the washed out guitars when taken away leave everything else very bare bones. i recommend you turn your attention the massively under-appreciated pale saints.

decent. when you sleep is an amazing song but the rest of the album is whatever. maybe i am just not a big fan of shoegaze or do not see the appeal. it is wayyy too long of an album for tracks that sound almost identical and would probably make you fall asleep and crash if you listened while driving.

i do not know if it is too late but i have always wanted to listen to the album because it is so praised. i am pretty new to the shoegaze direction but i really really like what i hear in loveless. the songs all have such a from far away effect i cannot put it into words but i hope you understand it to some extent. my favorite tracks were definitely blown a wish when you sleep and loomer. the whole album has a 60s-70s sound which i like a lot because i am a huge fan of this kind of music. in general i think it is really very good and really ahead of its time.

loveless really just feels that it is reaching for something it never grabs. it is hazy and distant vocals and atmospheric and rough production all seem to attempt to fully envelop the listener in the albums sound and emotion but it never truly works for me. it ends up feeling samey and repetitive instead of lush and exciting. i appreciate parts of its productions and can see the sound it aims for but all the elements of this album ultimately do not come together in my opinion. the vocals seem far too soft emotionless and distant. they blend pretty poorly with the more jagged and piercing production or feel buried by the more cloudy atmospheric production. they do not simply feel soft they feel lazy. despite the amount of work that went into the album most of it feels incredibly amateurish. like the idea to bury the vocals so deeply under the track feels like the failed decision of a newcomer hoping to distinguish themselves. its production like its vocals rarely ever feels emotive and feels incredibly bland and muted. the distortion fails to add any personality to the music and just makes it feel less distinct. it seems to try to capture some a cloudy and distorted sense of ethereality but just seems uninspired and weak. the guitars are the only elements i really get any enjoyment out of and that is when the album is straying furthest away from its sound. a soft grungy and atmospheric sound has been gracefully executed countless times and loveless seems so to try to replicate these sounds without any of the personality of its predecessors. it is a shame the sonics are so poorly handled as the lyrics are pretty effective at conveying themes of isolation and sadness. the lyrics are short but succinct yet they hardly seem to matter with the vocals so deemphasized. i may be misunderstanding the intent of the album but regardless of what sound emotion or idea it attempts to convey it fails to do so in my mind.
very gorgeous sound world. makes you feel like you are inhabiting candyfloss clouds. the mystery and i think a large part of the appeal of this album is how something so noisy can sound so pretty.
yeah overrated asf but still good. i see a lot of people call this peak music and all of them should be avoided at all cost this is good but not tiger by thaiboy digital.

for the longest time i have avoided reviewing and even talking about this album because i have never been truly able to express why it does not click for me. why such a landmark and universally acclaimed album in a genre i adore is just meh to me. i do not really like speaking negatively about albums especially albums that lots of people love nor do i like hearing people speak negatively about albums i love. songs sure but albums are a whole other ordeal. it is just who i am as a music fan. i guess that is why i am grateful for the go review game and more specifically insoluble77 for picking this album for me to review. it makes me face challenges with my music taste. enough whining it is time for me to explain my thoughts on this album. like i said it is difficult to explain why this album does not click for me. i will put it this way this album is one hazy psychedelic dream like practically no other album out there. even other shoegaze albums like to see the next part of the dream the texas-jerusalem crossroads or even is not anything do not compare to the immersive and kaleidoscopic atmosphere. for many people this dream is a life-changing utterly euphoric experience. it feels like nothing else in the world and they absolutely adore it. for me it is a mix of phenomenal uninteresting and grating. most times it is the latter two. the allure and singularity of the dream wear off quickly and all i am left with is just flashes of brilliance within a mix of aimless distortion. by the time i wake up from the dream i feel relieved that i am out of it yet at the same time i feel a certain level of respect for the dream and just how unique it was compared to most others i had. to put it in less metaphorical terms the songs on here mainly just sound noisy with no purpose. it leaves me wanting more which i get from other releases in the genre like the texas-jerusalem crossroads and night time my time. whereas those genres use the noise to support greater musical ideas and also to express the emotion that the artist is trying to convey the noise on loveless just sounds like my bloody valentine are trying to make the most unique alt rock album out there. where the album succeeds is when they focus on the songcraft. even i cannot deny the absolute perfection of only shallow or the killer chorus of when you sleep. the hazy erratic atmosphere actually works for me on to here knows when. however songs like loomer touched and blown a wish just bring the album down for me. it is a shame because if this album was as strong as its strongest songs it could have been one of my favorite albums of all time. as is it just does not work for me.

noise. noiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiise. i am sorry i do not care if i offend all the sweaty mulet us everything good in this album is obscured by a fucking avalanche of distortion and ambient sound that just kills it for me.

loveless is an album that everyone says is good but i just do not get it. yeah the shoegaze sounds nice however i cannot ever understand any of the vocals which may be the point of the music but its annoying to me.

jeg m konstatere at dette album kommer p listen over ekstremt hjt estimerede vrker som jeg simpelthen ikke kan se det store lys i - det er om muligt endnu mere stjet og dronet i smadder end forgngeren og jeg fr nrmest kvalme af at lytte til flere af numrene - de poppede when you sleep og i only said midtp skiller sig markant ud og er okay numre men derudover mest nej tak.

en passant jaime bien cet album certain vont trouver que cest un peu amateur comme groupe moi je crois que cest plutt le mix qui est assez moyen mais les chansons sont superbes du vrai shoegaze et du pure dream pop un re-mix serait essentiel quelquun comme steven wilson pourrait faire des miracles.

for the most part its enjoyable. love the super hazy noisy dream pop aesthetic that runs throughout here. not the biggest fan of the vocals however as they do not particularly layer well with some of the production i am going to. overall the record is a good vibe. personally though it feels just a bit too sleepy for my tastes. best tracks only shallow loomer touched when you sleep sometimes what you want

there is a special kind of talent - to make something work that does not seem to be able to work under any circumstances. this is a typical example. elephant guitars would be terrible everywhere but thanks to the support of bilindas soaring vocals they are redeemed and even manage to sound good - in contrast. it does not always work about a third of the album is terrible but it is still a great achievement.

albeit a classic and necessary component of contemporary underground rock canon for all it is critical merit loveless does not leave me in awe despite it is many accolades. let it not be misconstrued though i do love this album in my own way. i associate it more with my times of exploring more niche critically acclaimed bands or mu core if you will. not really any weak spots on the album that i can think of but the same sound all throughout can all feel like one really long song for the most part. perhaps that is what the dreamy noise of the album is trying to achieve though.

this was a drag of a listen. it was not bad but in a way it was worse than bad it was boring. ok let me explain. i did not dislike this album i can appreciate it for sure and i can see why people do like it but god this was annoying. a lot of this album does sound the same and that is coming from someone who loves drone music the issue here is it is all so uninteresting nothing ever jumped out to me i sat through the entire thing kind of waiting for something to happen nothing did of course and yes i have listened multiple times because i wanted to like this i wanted to love it even but god i just cannot let us dig into this then what do not i like? well there are two main factors the vocals and the noise. let us start with the vocals. the vocals are incredibly annoying to me this album sounds a lot better without them the only time they sound good is on sometimes and that is it the rest of the time they feel unnecessary and annoying i can understand the appeal to them but to me they kind of just got in the way of the enjoyment i know vocals are another instrument but this is an instrument this album could have done without. now i am no newcomer to quite high vocals beach house is a good example of a band who definitely take inspiration from mbv it is quite obvious but god they do it so much better. vocally this album grated me i really dislike these vocals and i doubt it is something i can look over in future listens. if i do come back to this. secondly the noise. i know the genre is noise pop so why am i complaining about this well. it is quite overbearing and again this is coming from someone who loves noise music the talkies ywgwyw xiu xiu. this just was not that it definitely fits the bill for noise but it felt a lot more merzbow than xiu xiu if you get what i mean. the sound of this album feels like if you inverted ywgwyw instead of being dark deep and battering it is quite high vibrant and positive. this album feels like heaven i do not mean that in a good way it feels like a light shining down on you into your eyes specifically. now there are definitely good points to this album some are very sparse and barely raise it up a point but i appreciate them then there are longer points like the ending to what you want or the entirety of sometimes there are points where i think maybe i should not rate this album so poorly but then they end and i am left with blinding lights. i will admit there were points to this where i was bobbing my head in enjoyment like on what you want i liked that song a lot as well as sometimes. i should probably explain why. sometimes sounded different to the other songs on here it was a lot calmer in sound and vocal performance the vocals are not overbearing and neither is the sound it feels contained and quite nice. this is the kind of sound i was expecting from this album not high synths screeching into my ears every couple seconds if the album was all what you wants and sometimes this would be an easy 10 but unfortunately that is not the case... at all. overall this album is just not good there are nice splotches here and there but looking at it from a contextual standpoint all these songs together as one to form an lp. not good. favourite tracks sometimes what you want least favourite tracks only shallow loomer when you sleep i only said come in alone

edit 27 may 2021 i decided to relisten to this album once again because i felt like giving it a second chance and it is with great certainty that i would like to say that this is still a 1.55. there is only three tracks that are a 2.55 or above on this album and only two that are above three stars. the rest of this album is either boring or painfully awful to sit through. touched and to here knows when are still one of the worst tracks i have heard. come in alone sounds like a non-acoustic version of my church choir it is bland and boring. sometimes is stupid. it is a shame that a great track like when you sleep was roped in to this diabolical mess. this album legitimately makes me think that my bloody valentine thought of two great tracks and decided to riff off those two tracks and make four more and on top of that make four more tracks that make no sense. if you like this album that is your opinion and i cannot get mad at that but i cannot see eye to eye with you. sorry. original review from 21 july 2020 below i have always wanted to get into shoegaze and this album specifically but now i realize that i have been making the biggest mistake of all time. i do not get the point of this album or what my bloody valentine were trying to accomplish. there were points where i had to take breaks while listening to this album because of how bad it was. i almost went to sleep because of this album. loveless is not for me. i will admit that there are some bright spots on this album. these bright spots are only shallow when you sleep i only said the chorus on only shallow is a very cool riff and the verses are kind of catchy. it does feel like it goes on for a big longer than it should have three verses for a song like this feels like a bit too much. the weird droning sounds are awesome. when you sleep is great all around. that synth-like guitar is sleek and a perfect fit and the verses are just amazing. i would argue that when you sleep is the best song on this album. in fact this is one of the only songs where the vocals are likeable. i only said has that weird melody going during the chorus and the drums are smooth. some of the songs would have benifited with less vocals such as only shallow and i only said. sometimes when i listen to these two songs i could have liked them way more if the vocals were not so over-dreamy. however the rest of this album is diabolical. there is so many ways i can describe the rest of this shitshow it is boring insulting melatonin it is like what the fuck? i have a question how do we go from a somewhat decent song with only shallow to three insufferable songs following after? loomer is so boring. what are the instrumentals trying to do? if confusion was the answer congratulations. this song makes no sense. the song following loomer is even worse. touched is dogshit and that is the best thing i can say about it. to here knows when is an actual song and yet it is as boring as the last two songs. it sounds like my bloody valentine were trying to accomplish everything yet the product sounds like nothing. to here knows when is the equivalent to unseasoned chicken. this song drones on for so long that i forgot that there were vocals. the only two good things on this song is the ending and that when you sleep comes after. the 30 second ending sounded way better than the 5 minute snoozefest. i am having a tough time picking between touched and to here knows when as the worst song on this album. touched is so fucking bad but at least it is only one minute. to here knows when is so boring and it goes on for 5 minutes. without moving away from talking about the vocals that is one of the biggest problems i have with this album the vocals. some people say that bilindas vocals are dreamy but i find that they ruin songs that could have been great and fuck over songs that were trash to begin with. i do not even know what she says more than half the time. if that is the point this is the shittiest concept album of all time. if that is the point of shoegaze it is the shittiest concept genre of all time. come in alone might start off decently on the first listen but like most songs on this album it gets ruined by the vocals. this song is slow yet still tries to sound like when you sleep which actually benefited from the speed. the mood each time the chorus comes in changes drastically which is not a good thing it just makes the listener mad. sometimes is more of the same as well strong start of a song ruined by the vocals. this time kevin shields wanted a part of the vocals. if this was supposed to be my bloody valentines version of a ballad they have failed in a major way. blown a wish is corny and what you want sounds like a cheap hybrid between only shallow and when you sleep. the ending makes me tired. i swear i heard a bruh sound effect in what you want. we wrap it all up with soon. to be honest i had high hopes for soon. i really thought that the song would at least give the album a strong finish---a saving grace even---but nope. soon sounds like a shoegaze spin on a cheesy teen pop song. at least it is somewhat catchy. the instrumentals are fine i can leave or take them. loveless somehow got popular but sometimes the people who make things popular are wrong. this album is not for me. i should not have to say this since it is my opinion but whatever sorry. 1.55

i get why this album is so revered. the heady tones of constant distortion just washes over you as you listen and it is incredible. when i first heard this album i was blown away by the grim majesty of it all as i had never heard anything like it. however as the years have gone by i have not only heard music of the same ilk that predates this but also music that is far more ambitious with what it tries to achieve. there are some amazing moments on here. i cannot deny how great it is to hear the album burst into life on the first track or wallow in the riff melding with the backing vocals on when you sleep. my issue is that all these great moments happen at the start of tracks. every song has such minimal development and it honestly gets a bit stale. this criticism can be applied to the whole album and while there are some nice changes between tracks because the album is loud all the way through the band have nowhere to go. you need some lows to appreciate the highs and the closest this album comes to that is to here knows when which has other issues that keep it from being very interesting. this lack of variation will become painfully apparent on soon which is a pretty unsatisfying ending. this album is really enjoyable. i know i have been harsh in my review but that is because it gets loads of praise already- i am just pointing out why i do not think it is anywhere near as incredible as it is made out to be.

this album sucks balls it tries to be all deep and philosophical but it just sucks balls at doing that! this album is for those edgy teenagers who think they are cool but they are really not so they act like they like this and give it 5 stars and any shoegaze can frick off too. 110

3  5 my bloody valentine were always in search of something in their aesthetic endeavors and it has always been loveless. it is where their intellectual discoveries were unanimously honored by the whole world. the balance of loveless brilliance comes from a violent storm of guitars surrounding a sweet and calm melodies. it evoked the beauty of nature in fury through a romantic persona. difficulty hard

i really wanted to like this album. lord knows i have tried but outside of roughly the first few songs there are not that many memorable moments. the songs tend to overstay their welcome especially in the latter half to the point of grating irritation. it is amazing that an album this noisy can be so dull and sedated. it is a shame because this could have been trimmed into a solid ep only shallow loomer to here knows when what you want

loveless 1991 by my bloody valentine is a cinma vrit-style documentary film that traces the story of the vinyl reissue of a lost album of my bloody valentines first seven studio albums. the film itself centers around the reissue of 1993s which disappeared for more than a decade before resurfacing as my bloody valentines first seven studio albums. the documentaries focus on this return to vinyl and are extremely well made and engaging although the viewer will want to know the history of the album itself. why did vinyl reissues never occur before? loveless also counts but the fact remains that there are plenty of songs that simply leave me cold. like say you made me realize. its simply too derivative to be worthwhile. remember when selling a song or band always take into consideration how the song fits in a scene or song that is already in place so if you are just jumping in and making a knock-off happy birthday because it is a commercial you might be committing a crime against pop culture and the other band members. then again if that song was the first song someone ever heard on a channel like mtv they probably did not have to know it was a copy of it could be considered a real song. can you think of

sometimes and soon are pretty interesting tracks but the rest of the record is monosonic and in the long run rather tiring. surely kevin shields spent a lot of effort to get the sound as it appears to be. the distorted guitars are pretty dominant and the other instruments and especially the vocals nearly disappear behind this guitar noise. unfortunately i do not like this a lot in the long run. sometimes und soon sind ziemlich interessante stcke aber der rest des albums ist eintnig und auf dauer ziemlich ermdend. kevin shields hat sich sicherlich viel mhe gegeben den sound genau so hinzukriegen wie er ist. die verzerrten e-gitarren sind sehr dominant und die anderen instrumente und speziell die vocals verschwinden fast unter diesem gitarren-noise. leider gefllt mir das auf dauer nicht sonderlich. top tracks sometimes soon
como  que algum pode gostar de um troo desses!

eu no sei at que ponto a mistura desbalanceada do dream pop com o noise foi calculado intencionalmente mas por vrios momentos a banda recorre ao dream e them outros ao noise como se estivesse indeciso por qual rota tomar. o que poderia ser um dos maiores defeitos se torna um dos seus maiores triunfos. um exemplo notrio dessa desorganizao so as faixas come in alone e sometimes sendo que a primeira  um noise pau mole que no sabe por onde seguir e a segunda praticamente uma balada romantica pop com ruidos. e o mais impressionante  que funciona them 70 do lbum. e casa com a letra. e a ambientalizao reflete muito melhor a gerao dos anos 20002010 do que parece ter refletido os anos 90. o problema so os outros 30 onde restam msicas vazias pouco inventivas que no precisavam estar no lbum. loveless  um lbum pretensioso ele no possui tanta potncia quando poderia ter e  bem irregular them sua estrutura mas seus bons momentos se destacam a ponto de conseguir justificar sua existncia e sua influncia se tornando um excelente pilar para o shoegaze.
some songs are really good but some are just meh if compared to other songs of the genre. these last ones can be really good too though if you are in the right mood.

though certainly listenable loveless is probably one of the most absurdly overrated albums in the history of popular music. and i have never been able to understand just why. on loveless mbv eschew what made them an outstanding band on their previous album great songwriting an acute sense of dynamics in favour of the stubborn exploration of a single idea. all the album offers is a collection of watered-down average indie pop songs disguised under a blanket of warm noise. a song like no more sorry on their previous album achieves much more in its less than 3 minutes than the whole loveless album on its 49 minutes of duration a triumph loveless? only if it is a triumph of style over substance or of single-mindedness over true creativity
granted the influence is great but holy fuck i could not even finish this i got so bored. i am sorry but it is going to take more than crappy mixing and 200 distortion pedals to peak my interest.
