a while back when i first heard loveless i was incredibly disappointed with it since i was expecting some sort of ber-shoegaze album i did not get what i thought i was getting and dismissed it as a failure. since then i have come to realize that i did not really know what shoegaze was supposed to be. since coming to terms with that i have realized this album is actually pretty good. i am still not 100 sold on it like many people are but i can find a lot of good things in it. it has a lot of good melodies and the songwriting is pretty solid. some of the songs are even catchy. even though i initially hated the mix claiming i could not hear anything meaningful in it it is grown on me and it actually does further the atmosphere of the music pretty well and i am able to pick things out more easily as well. the dronenoise bits are also decentnot excellent but i do not expect them to be they are not a noisedrone band. i still do not find the songs to be super-engaging nor do i find the layers of noiseswirling guitars to be as blissful and amazing so it is not the awesome five-star ultimate rock album ever like a lot of people claim but it is still a pretty good album.

i really appreciate what they are going for here i really do but this just does not do it for me. it is a fantastic idea but it just does not work for my ears. many of the sounds on this album are really grating to me and the layers upon layers of noise on here can just completely bore me on some of these tracks. this is an album i really wish i enjoyed more because there really are some great moments here. sometimes is a wonderful song as well as only shallow i just wish the rest of the tracks on the album were more like those tracks.

i really cannot get myself into liking this album at all which is odd since i am a big fan of shoegaze. normally albums that mix it with other genres - which may be the reason i have no love for loveless. despite that there are a few good tracks i can bear namely when you sleep but overall i really do not care for or about this enough to carry on writing.

let me be honest here objectively this is not a terrible though also not a good one much less a great one album and the studio trickery is actually impressive from a technical standpoint. i just fucking hate it. of all the albums in the top 100 loveless easily the most limp-wristed and soulless. dsotm and ok computer are overrated as hell too but at least those albums actually have great songs. this is just moaning and discordant pop tracks with a shit ton of reverb and people think that makes it a masterpiece. i have never once found this album to be compelling in any manner. it is the soundtrack to every masturbating self-pitying insincere retard who thinks they are some sensitive martyr too precious for this world.

i mean yeah it does not sound like anything else i have ever heard and there are some admirable moments on here for sure. but i mean it just got sorta old to me as guilty as i feel admitting it because i know i will be persecuted for this. i mean whatever dude. i just found everything to come across as a jumbled mess of noises. i still like quite a few songs on this though. i honestly cannot remember some of the songs on this though and i have listened to this like 4 times. 610

this album is considered an excellent album by almost anyone who hears it. the famous reviewer piero scarrufi gave the album a 910 saying the songs are drifting and performed distractedly with no action taken and are destined to exist in this state of permanent awe.. this album is consistently part of any graphic depicting what is mu core and has been praised by the community for as long as i can remember. even within my own personal circles of music fans the album is hailed as a classic. but for me this album is none of those things. never before in my life have i tried so hard to like a piece of media. some work has jumped to me instantly as classics like the velvet underground  nico. some other pieces took more time for me to understand like trout mask replica. i thought that this album would fall into the latter category after my first listen. i have probably listened to this album all the way through at least a dozen times in different attempts to understand it but every time i come away with nothing inciteful to draw from and wishing i spent some time with music i actually enjoy. one of my least favorite parts about the album is something that is brought up constantly in favorable reviews of the album the mixing. i read about the mixing being this dream-like blend of noise that soothes the listener. i have never gotten this experience out of this album. every time i play the record the sound out of my speakers or my headphones sounds like the drivers are trying to push out oatmeal. it comes off as sloppy to me without any greater artistic acoustic or thematic purpose. it even is not that i do not like noise in my music as post-hardcore no wave post-rock and power electronics have produced some of my favorite albums. i think this album suffers from a case of too many cooks in the kitchen with over a dozen engineers to the albums credit. it is not that i even think the album is bad. some songs on here like i only said are real standouts that were able to click for me. the album as a whole does not. i love many of the albums that were directly influenced by this album but the source itself does little for me. maybe i will return to this album again and finally find what everyone else has but until then this album will remain misunderstood by me.

i appreciate what the album is trying to do - create this droning tone throughout the entire work. and while this is new to me new does not equal good. most of the album sounds identical save for only shallow. i think that my bloody valentine could have done a better job of producing this tone while still giving each track personality and charm. highlights only shallow
noioso a tratti carino

just admit that you do not know about how popular this album is and listen to it with open ears. to me it sounded 1 sandpaperish on ears throughout 2 tunes one just like others 3 at the same time very original. but i see no reason to return to it to finally find its greatness behind the layers of noise noise and noise.

i am surprised what year this came out 1991. i figured it would need to be a little longer before musicians could make such a haunting and powerful sound coming out of my earbuds. everything is thrown up in the air the guitar is having a wonder while making riffs and wails everywhere. i think the instruments trump the main vocalist butcher though. the vocals is actually what made it need a few listenings to click. you need this in your niche for noise and in general dark and moody tunes that only the late 20th and 21st century could ever really make.

i have very mixed feelings on this. the opener is fantastic and after that i am kind of waiting for something amazing to brush my ears and it never quite happens. on the whole i like this album but i like a couple thousand albums many of them much more than this. no question it is beyond influential it is unique and textured so densely it is like drowning in tar. but it just does not quite scratch the itch i always feel a bit short changed.

even though i do not like this album i will not go lower than a 2.5 because there is nothing about it that i particularly dislike expect maybe the melody of when you sleep. the other side of that coin though is that i do not really like anything about it either. this is the musical equivalent of diluted fruit punch. it does not leave a bad taste in my mouth but it leaves me thinking that it could have been so much more. i am all for atmospheric production but that is where the creativity of this album ends. loveless does not do anything to justify its hazy vibes. there is no detail in the production and none of the melodies are close to memorable aside from the first track. this thing just goes in one ear and out the other. it is not even good music to just have on in the background as a lot of the dissonance and muddy production are pretty distracting. so yeah i do not get the hype.

i cannot get into this album. i do not think shoegaze is my genre. there is a couple songs i think are decent like only shallow. but as a whole i just do not really find enjoyment. i understand others liking this though. i get that it is about the atmosphere. it just does not do too much for me.
for ben i plan on listening to this with earphones on in my bedroom tonight. not sure if this will be before or after begging my mother to see crywank

this is an incredible inspirational record yet at the same time aggravating and anxiety-inducing. more than enough people have already commented on the good qualities of the album so i will summarize the bad. three key negatives in increasing order of harm one the male singer. why? why does he ever sing? he is not good. amateur at best. the female singer is gorgeous. stick with her. two the jarring transitions. i am literally shaken multiple times every time i play this album a song does a great job of entrancing me in a nice dreamy state and then scares the fuck out of me with a smashing powerful chorus to kick off a track. i would like something a bit smoother. three the repetitiveness. do i need an album to be atonal and multi genred? of course not do not strawman me in your head like that. does the looping refrain and drums get extremely predictable and similar as the album goes on? hell yes. there is so many cool things going on in this album yet it so frequently uses its own sound as inspiration for more of itself. i feel like i am driving in a roundabout and at every turn i can see these great things in the distance but i miss my turn and end up back where i was. so frustrating! overall it is good but nothing more. top album of its year? give me a break the 90s are over stop letting nostalgia cloud your judgment.
i might be one of the few people who just enjoy the songs just for the songs themselves rather than the wall of noise. this aspect of the music does not do too much for me with this particular band.

i guess i understand why this album is so highly rated. it is a contender for the best-sounding album of all time. all the whacky recording and production techniques the band employed make loveless still sound unique today. sure people have tried to recreate the magic but you still know when you are listening to the real loveless and not some bedroom producer-ass wannabe. they will never capture the thick ghosts of sound that mbv did! so why did i give it a 35 then? the answer is pretty unsatisfying the songwriting does not click with me. well it clicks three or four times. loveless would be an absolute favorite of mine if it was a 19 minute ep with a tracklisting of only shallow when you sleep sometimes and what you want. only shallow is a great way to start the album off. it is so heavy and satisfying. it makes me know that i am beginning a classic. when you sleep is simply one of the greatest songs i have heard in my life. it is so bittersweet that it breaks my heart every time i hear it. it just so innocent and melodic! i love it so much! i am trans!!! not actually sometimes is the perfect song to listen to when you have a broken heart and you are laying on a couch. what you want is pretty good... ..... .... ... everything else is just sleepy to me unfortunately. the melodies are only okay and they repeat forever until i forget that i am listening to music. it is weird because there is nothing tangibly different between my favorite tracks and the others. maybe i just have really bad taste. i listen to fucky. part of rymasters volume five i journey through systematicdeclines top 100 abandoned

loveless is perhaps the album that i most appreciate but do not necessarily enjoy. this is an attempt at something that i think the world needs more of texture-based rockpop music and for 1991 i greatly appreciate the effort of something like that being done. there is just one problem the textures range from uninteresting to dated and incredibly obnoxious to me. while some of the tracks are pretty great sometimes it still suffers the same fate as other tracks. the melody that comes in later on in the track is great but the actual texture of it feels very artificial and ugly to me but this is definitely the best use of these textures throughout the album. this problem persists on pretty much every single track with either the melody or harmony being played by some ugly artificial and dated sounding texture that completely takes me out of the mood the album is going for. the worst offender of these is i only said which has probably the worst texture of them all and it is mixed so loudly and it loops so incessantly over the 5 12 minute runtime that it destroys any semblance of stomachability that this track had for me. the drum sound is also not very good for most of the album a side effect of a drum machine being used for most of it. that is not even to mention the songwriting which is pretty much just standard alt rock to me with nothing really standing out aside from the aforemented sometimes. even when the texture does not get in the way on a track like only shallow for example the songs are not really interesting enough for it to make a difference. all the respect in the world to people that like this album but i have been waiting for 3 years for this thing to click but it only seems to get more and more frustrating with time. sorry.

with complete seriousness every song after only shallow sounds like a bunch of irishmen farting around on grating guitar soundscapes and unintelligible and unpleasant vocalization. i cannot do it man. i cannot. i really detest my bloody valentine

just too much going on in this album. it is just all over the place and does not feel cohesive at all. basically it is like i was just listening to a bunch of otherworldly noises that a computer could create automatically. just not feelin it. i like psychocandy by the way. maybe after a hit of acid i could get into this kind of fuzzy style over substance stuff.

so uhhh this was better than is not anything at least. loveless was a bit more consistent overall compared to is not anything but once again it is rather monotone and boring. mbv sound like an indie rock band who were randomly inspired by sonic youth and decided to add a bunch of noise to their music. now while i am a champion of noise distortion grunge and the like in my music it just makes this album muddy and samey. i feel like it could have been better if all of that noise mud was cleared up and they had gone for a cleaner sound which would lend to their pop-like sound hidden underneath.
can i possibly be hearing the same thing as the people who love this album? httpsen.wikipedia.orgwikifoliec3a0deux

now really what do i have to say about loveless? the music gave me headaches the first time i heard ithell it still doesbut what kept me at this album was partly the acclaim and partly those vocal harmonies. loveless was like nothing i would heard before. it transcended the boundaries of what i considered rock music. now those very same harsh guitars that drove me away from this album contain effervescent qualities to them. the subtle bubbling that emulates life and hope in the world. even at the most accosting moments of loveless an indivisible force continues to pull my mind within its world of soundscapes. even as the initial appeal that to here knows when begins to slow down which in itself was the revival from touched when you sleep comes on. the action of the album exponentiates as when you sleep reaches its apex and i only said shifts in. the actual music here actually does not have a big impact on me. what it has done for music and for me that is what is important.

i do not know why but i do not love this album. at least as much as other people do. i am a fan of shoegaze but here i feel the melody is too drowned in distortion. there are certainly songs i truly enjoy when you sleep is a personal favorite and i can understand the aesthetic and technical innovation here. but the rest of the album fails to connect with me and it does not have the sense of variety or momentum i was hoping for after hearing such high praise of it.

i am sorry because i am sure that many here will disagree with me on this review but nonetheless i have to be honest for my integritys sake. this is perhaps the single most overrated album at rym and possibly in the history of modern music. not only is this music really bad ... terribly bad. purposefully off-key and static-y ... but this album is rated as top 7 of all time albums on here. i had no idea that so many people had such bad taste. i mean - i would rather listen to the sound of new york city traffic for hours on end over this pile of shiznit. seriously. again - i am being honest. the only reason i rate this album 2 stars rather than 1 is because the vocals are actually very good! but sadly great vocals are not saved by shite music!

brummm brummmm brummmmmm sleep like a pillow no one there where she will not care anywhere soft as a pillow touch her there where she will not dare somewhere brummm brummmm brummmmmm hmmmm... anspieltip when you sleep kaufempfehlung wohl klassiker aber nicht meiner!

loveless definitely has a shock factor associated with it the first time you listen to it. heck the first ten or twenty times even. but after you get past the adrenaline rush of listening to the best vacuum cleaners you have ever heard you realize that underneath that layer there is only a couple of fairly simple alt rock songs. and that would be entirely fine if these songs were not so tediously repetitive. the biggest offender is i only said which has a pretty good violin melody which gets repeated until you cannot stand it anymore but honestly the same applies to most of the songs after the first three. only shallow is easily the best track on here followed by loomer. i only want to listen to this occasionally when i have forgotten what the vacuums sound like and want to re-experience it for a bit. but on any given day i would much rather listen to something like ujubasajuba which has the added benefit of being available on spotify in my country.
bleh. not my thing. if i want to zone out to a dense fuzzy album that feels like it is damaging my hearing then i will spin some emperor.
tuneless tripe. and even if there were tunes under all that noise why should i have to wade through the noise to get to them? it is not worth the effort.
boring and overly pretentious.

seit fast 25 jahren hre ich mir diese platte immer mal wieder an um herauszufinden was ich verpasst habe aber ich komm nicht drauf. immer wieder versuche ich zu ergrnden was so viele an dieser platte so gut und so elementar finden. erst heute wieder habe ich es versucht wirklich versucht. ich wrde gerne eine bessere wertung geben aber die platte erreicht mich einfach nicht. vielleicht kann es mir jemand erklren. ich hre gerne indie ich hre auch gerne shoegazer aber hier ist mir zuviel noise mit zuwenig guten melodien. meiner meinung nach gibt es bessere shoegazer-platten und viel bessere indie-platten. aber ich gebe nicht auf. vielleicht belehrt mich ja jemand und sagt mir genau wodrauf ich achten muss. und wenn ich sie dann nochmal hre bin ich ach gerne bereit meine wertung zu verndern auch wenn das keinen interessiert.

enjoyable but way overrated. the vocals are pleasant but of the generic dreamy female rock vox variety and the songwritings really nothing special. what sets it apart is the atmosphere the murky layered guitars drenched in feedback. basically the album sounds like it is fretboard drowning in cough syrup album cover.

loveless is one of those albums whose monumental praise is hard to escape. i would heard of my bloody valentine far before i was even really into music and i have seen the cover for loveless plastered on just about every top albums list imaginable. everywhere it is mentioned everyone talks about the story behind it. how kevin shields bankrupted the label trying to get the right sound and moving through several studios. how the label mishandled everything and the album went unknown until later appreciation came about. the main problem with this story is that it is bullshit. shields has since admitted that the label was already bankrupt when they started the album and it seems that the whole background story for this album was started as a sort of marketing gimmick. not only that but the more i read about this albums production the less effort it seemed like the band really put into this lp. the fact of the matter is that loveless is a memorable sonic experience but an almost entirely forgettable songwriting experience. the waves of fuzzy distorted guitars piled on top of each other droning on for minutes at a time create a very distinct a lush sound for the songs while the vocals are pushed far back into the mix and the drums even further back. it seems that these two elements were pushed back because upon further inspection they are pretty damn bad. the lyrics and i hesitate to even really call them that make no sense and were essentially written as a half baked guessing game between shields and butcher. i am a firm believer that if you do not have good lyrics you should not include them in your music if you want pleasant vocals just pull a sigur ros and sing nonsense openly do not pretend like you have something to say. production aside this is one of the most lopsided albums ever recorded. the first half is clearly superior to the second with pretty much every track after come in alone being dispensable. the first half though has quite a few nice tracks when you sleep is the obvious highlight of the album with its high pitched squeeling guitar refrain and only shallow is a pretty kickass opening track. touched has a very unique sound to it that makes me wish it were longer and to here know when and loomer like all the songs on side two are ultimately pretty mediocre but they get by because they have a unique sound. i suppose if you really love the aesthetic of this albums sound you will probably think its a perfect album. but if you dig just below the surface to analyze what is actually going on musically i think you will find that it is a somewhat half-assed effort. i am certain the hype and marketing of this album played no small role in its adoption as a sort of decade defining masterpiece it would have to because this album on its own merits does not deserve all the praise it gets. overall cool sound just could have used a cooler band.
perhaps i would enjoy this album a lot more if at least a couple more songs actually had tunes underneath all the haze.

monotone singers which sound hiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiggggggggggghhhhhhhh as hell. repetitive guitar chords. simplistic song styles. but it works for me. the atmosphere on this album is pretty epic! and a lot of the beats are pretty damn cool. though i could not understand a word that the talkers were saying. i refuse to call them singers. still it seems crazy to call this the 9th best album of all-time. but it is pretty damn unique. the b-side is much better than the a-side.

lo tengo l 25 anni in un luogo protetto al buio e al fresco per degustarlo al momento giusto e quando finalmente lo apro cosa scopro? quello che tutti gli amici di rym dicevano fosse un chateau latour del 1991 risulta essere una coca cola anche un po sgasata. mah! che scherzi.magari non era da invecchiare...
i crashed with a wall of boring noises and a dispassionate voice.

niekomfortowa sytuacja w ktrej nikt nie chciaby si nigdy znale wchodz do pokoju penego ludzi. pocztkowo wszystko wydaje si normalne lecz tu po chwili zaczynam dostrzega wicej. wszyscy s czym zaabsorbowani rozmawiaj troch odmienny niezrozumiay sposb. nie jestem pewien czy znam ten jzyk i nie mam pojcia co maj oznacza ich gesty. w gowie pojawia si tak mnstwo pyta szukam odpowiedzi zaczynam pyta kogokolwiek. brak nici porozumienia. musz si podda i zaakceptowa napotkan sytuacj. wanie tak czuj si za kadym razem kiedy sysz o loveless. do drugiej pyty my bloody valentine podchodzithem z ogromnymi oczekiwaniami. przeczytathem mnstwo opinii ludzi ktrzy wychwalali j pod niebiosa uznawali za co przeomowego. wielu przekonywao e grzechem jest nie usysze tego albumu. chciathem to jak najszybciej nadrobi... ale zaraz zaraz. czym jest shoegaze? w tamtych czasach bythem wystarczajcym ignorantem eby zupenie nie zna tego nurtu. wtedy po raz pierwszy spotkathem si z pojciem ciany dwiku zyskathem troch inne spojrzenie na muzyk. posuchathem jednego z singli promujcych krek to byo troch... inne ale nawet ciekawe. zdecydowathem si da irlandczykom szans. kto wie moe si polubimy? pierwsze dwiki only shallow wzbudziy we mnie pierwsze wtpliwoci. ten pocztek ktry pniej okaza si instrumentalnym refrenem... jak to ubra w sowa? stado soni ucieka z ogrodu zoologicznego przez miasto pogrone w robotach drogowych - taki jest refren tego kawaka. kto inny okreli go jako sonia uwizionego w windzie - wszdzie sonie. zwrotki tworz kontrast - spokojny kobiecy wokal okraszony dream popowym brzmieniem. czuj si wtedy jakbym sucha bajki ktrej historia powoli si rozpywa w wielu momentach wida jej znieksztacenia. o wiele bardziej potrafi utosami si z sennymi zwrotkami ni ze wspomnianym chaosem w refrenie ktry sprawia e cay klimat zostaje kompletnie zmieniony wszystko do czego si przyzwyczaithem w jednej chwili przeksztaca si w ruin. mylathem e przywykn do tej atmosfery i dalej bdzie tylko lepiej. kiedy zacz si loomer od razu do gowy przyszo mi e pocztek jest cakiem obiecujcy. czekam na jakie rozwinicie... ale ono nie nadeszo. zostawiono mnie z md cian dwiku oraz niewyranym wokalem. owszem w ramach refrenu pojawia si bardziej wyrazista melodia ale to troch za mao. czy moe zrobi si dziwniej? oczywicie pokaza mi to touched. nawet nie wiem czy traktowa to jako utwr. brzmi to troch jak wypadek przy pracy bd minuta materiayou ktra w niewyjaniony sposb wkrada si na loveless. z kolei to here knows when to powrt do bajki z pierwszego kawaka moe bez agresywniejszych momentw. kolejna opowie na dobranoc ktra jest znieksztacona tym razem nie rozumiem z niej nic a nic. w tym momencie w mojej gowie zrodzio si pytanie czy ktokolwiek sucha loveless dla tekstw? warstwa liryczna nie wyglda na skomplikowan polega raczej na malowaniu abstrakcyjnych obrazw przekazywaniu emocji ale czasem trudno jest jeden wers poczy z drugim. przyznam si e musiathem poszuka tekstw eby zrozumie z tego cokolwiek. nareszcie nadszed moment kiedy mog irlandczykw pochwali. when you sleep by tym singlem dziki ktremu poznathem my bloody valentine. wraz z pierwszymi dwikami poczuthem przypyw energii ktra ubywaa mi powoli od only shallow. gitary po raz kolejny sugeruj pewn zadziorno ale tak naprawd jest to piosenka dla zakochanych. uwaam j za najlepsz na caej pycie poniewa najbardziej w niej czuj nocny marzycielski klimat ktrego oczekiwathem. nawet wokale s bardziej zrozumiae niezwykle harmonijne. muzycznie potrafi si tu odnale - wiem jakich elementw si zapa eby nie straci koncentracji i bya to dla mnie przyjemna czterominutowa wycieczka. wraz z i only said powracam na ziemi. po wielu odsuchach nadal jestem skonny stwierdzi e refren jest kakofoni znw jest mi troch niedobrze tak jakby kawaek zosta przesodzony. w kolejnym utworze come in alone linia melodyczna wokalu ma pewien potencja ale sowa znw s niezrozumiae a reszty brzmienia w ogle nie kupuj. rozumiem e wiele z tych zabiegw maj tworzy klimat ale zamiast tego raczej mnie odpychaj. wielu suchaczy rozpywa si nad sometimes i chyba rozumiem dlaczego. bez wtpienia jest to jeden z lepszych momentw na caej pycie. utwr jest jak ballada cho wci jest z nami haas gitar. nie jest to moe fenomenalne ale nie powoduje we mnie adnych negatywnych odczu to niezy kawaek. dobre wraenie popsu mi nastpny utwr blown a wish. nie potrafi posucha przez dyousz chwil tej melodii zwaszcza wokalu o ile to jest wokal w refrenie. po raz kolejny staram si zrozumie dlaczego shoegaze w tym wydaniu jest taki mdy dlaczego wydaje mi si by taki bez wyrazu. w blown a wish nie ma nic co mogoby mnie zainteresowa albo poprowadzi przez kilka minut kompozycji. nastpny w kolejce what you want troch podnosi poziom przypomina mi o magii z when you sleep z tym e po czterech minutach zaczyna nuy. na szczcie ten kawaek zostaje uratowany przez kocwk. w ostatniej minucie nie ma haasu adnego szumu tylko minimalistyczny dwik klawiszy zapewne stworzony za pomoc samplera. to naprawd magiczna minuta zabawienie si kontrastem z czystym sumieniem mog przyzna e ciarki pojawiaj si na caym moim ciele. dowiadczam pewnie tego samego co wielu suchaczy w trakcie odsuchu tej pyty od deski do deski. soon ostatni numer na pycie wydaje si by bardziej bezporedni ni wikszo albumu. po pewnym czasie pojawiaj si jednak te same problemy. utwr jak dla mnie jest za dugi i przede wszystkim brakuje mu esencji czego co przykuwaoby uwag. nie mog powiedzie e nic si nie dzieje. wrcz przeciwnie dzieje si sporo ale po raz kolejny brakuje mi elementu ktrego mgbym si zapa i czerpa z tej muzyki przyjemno. to nie jest tak e posuchathem loveless dwa razy po czym zjechathem od gry do doyou i rzucithem w kt. starathem si da tej pycie szans podchodzithem do niej kilkukrotnie po miesicu przerwy ale to wci nie byo to. przeczytathem wiele pochlebnych recenzji ale nie mogthem uwierzy e opisywane jest to samo nagranie. kto mgby mnie nazwa hejterem shoegazeyou ale to te nie bdzie prawda. moje inne podejcia do gatunku okazay si troch bardziej pomylne. niektre albumy powizane z tym gatunkiem maj you mnie naprawd wysokie miejsce. potrafithem przekona si do slowdive moe ich styl odpowiada mi bardziej od haasu. w internetowym wiecie kr memy i arty czce brzmienie loveless z chrem odkurzaczy. dla osoby ktrej ta pyta nie odpowiada... tak jest naprawd! doceniam zaplecze kevina shieldsa wiem e on i jego zesp znaj si na rzeczy ale tego albumu doceni nie mog. nie mog go nazwa nudnym ale ma w sobie co odpychajcego wydaje si wty. okadka dobrze ilustruje brzmienie - s gitary jest niewyranie i cukierkowo ale a za bardzo. mimo wszystko polecam zapozna si z loveless choby dlatego e jest uznawany za pyt definiujc gatunek oraz jedno z waniejszych muzycznych zjawisk w latach 90. czuj si troch dziwnie bo to tak jakby fan nowojorskiego rapu nie przepada za illmatic. nie wykluczam e za kilka lat wrc do tej pyty i odkryj jej fenomen ale dzi nie ma na to szans. tak oto pozostathem bez mioci... do loveless.

you know what this reminds me of? a cocktail maybe a pink mojito. something sweet and bright that makes me feel buzzed and sleepy. even the occasional dissonant noises are not that offputting if anything they add to the ambience. but what can i get from this that i cannot from picopop apart from bilinda butchers lovely vocals? both have a wall of sound effect but something like super miracle circuit is just much more sonically diverse and plain old appealing to me at least. loveless is immersive and relaxing i will give it that and it is very pretty but a bit on the monotonous side. i just do not see how this is so groundbreaking. and i like it but it does not spark anything in me.

tra i dischi che vorrei pi amare in assoluto c loveless dei my bloody valentine. uso il condizionale perch a fine ascolto rimango sempre con un po di amaro i bocca. complessivamente lalbum mi piace moltissimo. ha unorganicit non indifferente ottime melodie sognanti avvolte da una pellicola noise che non prende mai il predominio. tutto  fatto molto bene compresa la splendida voce di bilinda butcher ottimamente accompagnata dalle parti di kevin shields. allora perch non  uno dei miei dischi preferiti di sempre? a conti fatti trovo che lunica canzone epocale sia when you sleep assieme alle belle only shallow e sometimes. tutto il resto  funzionale ma meno ispirato. da un album cos incensato onestamente pretendo di pi. chiudo ribadendo che when you sleep  roba da polluzione notturna.

bandcamp is a bad word these days. brings to mind images of poorly thought-out aesthetics and people dabbling in genres for no real reason. throw-away one-off act-less etc. and this album this is why. see this is probably the most popular indie release ever. it is here on rym. and because of that the ideas sounds and aesthetics here get copied and rehashed and redone sometimes on purpose and sometimes totally by accident. could be that a band was influenced by another band who was influenced by another band and so on down the line until you reach my bloody valentine. a dude i know just started a shoegaze band and released an ep on bandcamp and i am pretty sure the only shoegaze he is heard is this and feast of love. what i do not think he realizes is this album cost the bands label around a quarter of a million pounds and also that pity sex is not very good. you just cannot make this stuff in a couple weeks on a thousand dollar budget. i am all for independent music but this stuff has got to stop. bandcamp is a bad word because nobody is trying anything new and everybody wants to put their derivative under-length projects up as fast as possible. it is a miracle that anybody even heard deathconsciousness. anyway about the actual content here loveless is in a word dated. it is a good album and i am sure that it like her big brother nevermind were pretty mindblowing at the time i guess nobody had heard hsker d yet but today loveless just sounds like an alt rock record. same with nevermind. sure there is lots of cool ideas riffs and they are certainly unique to a point but in the end it is a sound that was once cutting edge and is now old and dull. you have got to be so high that you have forgotten about slowdive and have a nice life to really enjoy this as the five-star album it is said to be. even the standout tracks here only shallowto here knows whenwhen you sleepi only saidsoon wear out their welcome incredibly quickly with one riff or chord progression rotating in a way that for a less immediate-sounding band like have a nice life would be flattering but for my bloody valentine after a couple listens starts to feel less and less mature thought out etc... even the lyrics here are on that billy corgan level of just pushing the 13 year old aesthetic and all this albums parts only work in a vacuum free from the culture and music of the last 25 years. i try hard to listen to music in a vacuum i think it lends to a better listening experience but for loveless for me now that the first impression has worn off it is almost impossible. verdict still a classic whatever that means

so this is the new velvet underground  nico and ok computer  new despite having been released about 23 years ago today. while the average rating of most highly rated albums have been going down at rym loveless has been almost constantly heading up. so is it that good? what do you expect from a reviewer whose favourite vu album is loaded favourite radiohead album is kid a and favourite stereolab album is cobra and phases group play voltage in the milky night? honestly despite having heard some my bloody valentine back in the early 1990s at my friends i used to think it was loveless but it must really have been is not anything i was almost shocked when the first sounds of only shallow met my ears. someone goes into a studio takes a lot of time and produces a sound like this? weird!! i did not know if that was a good or bad thing. the soundscape remains very ground-breaking to my ears on the other hand music is not only sound and this dominant sound buries most other musical features under the surface. however if the music is otherwise strong enough that can be forgiven and embraced. now we are facing the question are the songs of loveless strong enough? yes and no. when you sleep what you want and the lengthy closing number soon which might be played between happy mondays and early atomic swing are the most decent while i only said sometimes blown a wish and the aforementioned only shallow are not much worse. so after all the dominant feature on loveless is still the overall sound. i like it in a way of course. but perhaps what loveless really is is the merriweather post pavilion of the 1990s. i prefer this one and naturally mbv was around first but anyway the tricks are similar.
un absoluto montn de mierda. slo para adolescentes esnobs y pajilleros de rym.

the vocals a mere whispering the rest an almost impenetrable wall of noise. my bloody valentine created the epitome of shoegaze with their third album loveless. whereas the title hints at something cold and harsh the performance is rather sensitive with the sheer drone of all the layers of guitars as a protecting blanket for the melancholy band. as the album oscillates between more concise yet hazy indie rock only shallow noisy random songwriting to here knows when and odd keyboard miniatures touched diversity unfortunately falls by the wayside. this makes the album feel longer as it actually is. loveless may be genre defining but it also is a huge blurry dirge that leaves little room for particularly inspired moments. highlights only shallow lowlights to here knows when

there is a thing about concept albums although they show new ways to make musiccreate whole new genres they rarely work as an actual sonic experience. loveless is just a template for others to come and refine it so it can sound good. a noble first that i approve of but very little in terms of substance. there is simply not much here that i actually enjoy listening.

usually i do like shoegaze and noisy stuff but this album somehow failed quite a bunch on me. even though it is apparently something that is a classic i struggled to find this interesting. i do like the album cover and the sounds is quite ok for most time. but the thing with this album is that it was quite much a dream poppy take of shoegaze. and as i kept listening i got more and more bored with the album as variety seems to be an unknown element here. the album keeps going and going and going but atleast i did not find that much evolution or new elements on it after listening a while. might be a classic but this apparently just was not for me.

this is a good album as that it is better than most though it has flaws. to this listener it sounds like the band has an original sound but they do it to death. almost like they wrote the same song over and over. also there is kind of a outdated 90s rock sound at times which is still commendable because it predates all that possibly influenced much of it. alot of the songs have only two parts it switches back and forth too. there is a repetitiveness which may evoke a certain mindset the artists were intending for the listener i personally have a problem with. there is alot of nice sounding parts within though. it starts off strong but starts wearing a little thin.
it is like these guys discovered something completely untouched and relevant but did not know what to do with it in the end. after all how far can fuzz go in making a song truly good?

the perception of a good album as a collection of some good songs have recently became a common knowledge. the concept album died and people almost does not listen to whole albums any more. my bloody valentines loveless is an album from another era when the medium of the album considered as more important than the medium of the song. a clear concept or at least a partial musical uniformity was any albums duty. the problem with the album era which seems so alluring in the nostalgia district is the lack of attention to the song as an independent art work regardless of the context of it is album. theoretically loveless is a fine album. the sound is interesting the development is surprising the concept exists. but the songs? santa maria. mostly they are as long as the amazonas. unfortunately the lyrics are not necessarily as deep as the amazonas but who cares it is impossible to understand anything that this miserable singers say behind their bad diction and a thick layer of the indefensible over distorted guitars and the kitschy synthesizer. nowadays to make a good pop album a well done entirety is not enough. every song in an album should be both specifically good and connected to the whole album. i sad to say that loveless just does not stand the test of time.

still really good but i feel like it could have been better without all that noise and feedback layered on top. whenever you get a nice melody you also have to contend with something noisy at the same time. not a holy grail as some would have you believe but it is still got some very nice songs on there my favorites being when you sleep come in alone and sometimes. real solid.

lay down some fuzz and throw an oft-irritating whiny melodic guitar hook on top. sometimes seems to break the mould somewhat and stray into more notably effective territory negating some of the awkwardly dated sound and execution. it is pleasantly inoffensive and flows well i guess. 2.5 stars  mediocre

luckily i have almost no background in dream popshoegazewhatever shit term you come with to vindicate instilling a doze of sugary poppy catchiness into your repetitive artsy indie rock. so i can judge this album on its musical merits alone without taking into account how much influential groundbreaking or successful with its prospective audience it was. yeah i know that loveless is a highly revered album and often seen as some sort of peaking achievement regarding the whole 80s90s alternative scene. but you know i am a frank guy and this sort of things cannot prevent me from declaring loveless as useless crap if i am feeling exactly that way. so on the rolling drums loveless is a prime example of useless crap. those pseudo-creative middle-class hipsters who feel offended by this candid statement can give up on reading my review already but i will explain my opinion with slightly more detailing. dreamy soundscapes pulsating bass and fuzzy but subtle guitars can be good even if set in a totally mellow and very electronized setting. but this type of music can be good when it is supported by bright and lucid melancholic melodies genuine union between fluid clear songs flow and clever use of crescendoes and stuff like that which enhances it with a sense of progression and variability. as long as you still have guitars some solid riffs will not hurt either. but on loveless the situation is drastically different. extremely repetitive and bland simple guitar chords cannot be interpreted as something worthwhile even with all the deliberate blurriness of sound which actually muffles and drown  them out as you can guess taken into account. annoying joyously feel-good primitive poppy melodies cannot invest you with some sort of melodic brilliance. heavy-handed use of inoffensive and trite noise-rock elements does not make you forward-thinking and avantgarde. clicky drums really taxing listeners patience with their extremely monotonous and uninventive character and sloppy dance-ish beats do not help either. and wait a moment on the top of all this ill-fated malady we have that god-awful vocals. you can be mellow and good. friggin pink floyd proved it. but this infamous amount of syrupy saccharine bullshit of vocals yet these vocals are definitely pretentious and surely get lauded as being so original and conjured with outside-the-box mentality by worthless pitchforkian musical critics is maybe the most annoying feature of mbvs music. these saccharine vocals suit sugary melodies though but if some shitty feature looks appropriate to some other shitty feature there is nothing to be overexcited about. you know hysterical mumble suits hitlers message of hate high-societys arrogant bitch appearance suits thatchers creepy character being terribly ugly suits lady gagas ludicrous make-up and comic antics onstage toothless sappy melodies of my bloody valentine suit mawkish bilinda butchers vocals shields ones are not significantly better by the way. by the way bilinda first i mind it not e she is so original and unlike you dirty proles! butcher - hell it is even a more laughable name than balsac the jaws of death from gwar only her is real. well i am done. it is a worthless crap. but what do you want from a band with a name as lame as my bloody valentine? st. vitus demonstrated us that albums with pink cover can be damn solid. but here we have a sonical equivalent of a crime against humanity. a couple of half-decent melodies lost in this sea of poppy cheese dressing up as progressive thinking music save loveless from being rated with 0.5 stars but it comes terribly close to it. this insipid gutless and primitive album surely deserves a mention as one of the most overrated albums of all time. as flavor flav once kindly put it do not believe the hype.

i just cannot really get into this. everything sounds nice and all but the only real stand-out tracks for me are sometimes and soon. only shallow starts off really well with that drum but the following couple of minutes just do not really connect with me. as does most of this. i come back to it every now and then because i like the general sound of it and see it as a agreeable-to-good album but i cannot shake the feeling that there is something here i am missing.

acab durante ms de 10 minutos repasando el disco original a ver si el que me lo vendi me haba dado el cambiazo puesto que los comentarios de la gente en los que suelo estar de acuerdo lo ponan por las nubespues en fin....lo he puesto una veintena de veces y hasta alguna noche me he parado a pensar que coo pasa con este disco que no consigo hacerme con l la voz me parece mala no... lo siguiente su msica carece de sentido alguno y en algunos tramos me hacen intentar olvidar a algunas tardes de trabajo en una factora de coches de cuyo nombre no quiero recordar si esto es todo lo mejor que nos poda dejar esta gente quiz sea mejor que no vuelvan a sacar nada ms. que este disco est en la lista por encima del kind of blues o a love supreme o el ziggy stardust es un autntico insulto a la msica. y por supuesto no est ni en mi listado de los 100 mejores de los 90. si esto es una obra maestra tenemos el listn rozando suelo. sigamos al rebao de comentarios seores.

i feared it would be worse to my taste just another shoegazey borefest. it still caused me a headache but i did find some pretty rocking grooves and the thing overall still has more balls than their peers.
really good. it is a pop album that gets it is catchiness from the texture of the sound foregoing the usual chord progression style. recommended.
bleh. not my thing. if i want to zone out to a dense fuzzy album that feels like it is damaging my hearing then i will spin some emperor.
this collection of random guitar-related noises just hurts my ears.

one of the best things about loveless is how many adjectives come to my mind when i think of it. there is simply so much here to explore. i have listened to it hundreds of times and have never tired of its perfection or thought it any blander from how great it was when it first clicked with me. it is strange to me that anyone would suggest that loveless is anything but flawless. although it occurred to me the other day that soon is perhaps slightly too long and i can definitely understand that everyone has a preference for certain songs off of it. but the song order on this album is immaculate and its originality and sculptural noisy beauty is unsurpassed. the melodies in songs like come in alone and when you sleep are so saccharine and utterly perfect. i see loveless as a gorgeous painting conceived under the influence of a powerful hallucinatory trance. songs like i only said and blown a wish exemplify the androgynous fetal beauty that characterizes the album. the sensual seductive guitar riffs and painterly waves of static are what make it so tantalizing to me. my understanding of its brilliance only improves with each listen but ultimately its most important accomplishment is its blending of textural sonic art with the pop music formula. i simply see loveless as a monolithic piece of visual physical music that also happens to be comprised of pop songs. everything that sounds anything like it owes it to this album. loveless is essential not only because of its wide-ranging influence but its landmark accomplishment of being such a unique sensory record that makes the listener feel sensations that do not exist on any other album.

first in the mid to late 90s and was left perplexed it was a bit early on or seemed to be on the internet induced lovefest of this album before it became totally uncool to not like it but it was becoming more and more uncool by the day. i snatched this up at my favorite music store rip farwell music in milwaukee wi. i remember taking it home with all kinds of expectations it was a known album do not get me wrong but was not one of those--my god there is nothing better than ever insert hipster this second with hipster that and close with hipster hipster albums..... i turned it on and instantly was greated with a great guitar sound.... but then the vocals kicked in and yech..... i tried for a few months and still yech.... i think i actually ended up giving this for nothing to my best friendcollege roommate.....he liked it for what it is worth..... ok so since those days midlate 90s the internet lore has skyrocketed so maybe in late 2011 i checked this out from the library hopingwishing that maybe some 13-15 yrs on perhaps my tastes had changed a la here come the warm jets--eno and i would really dig this guy.... well know...it is the vocals they grate my soul. i cannot stomach this one. 15 seems both fair and accurate. sorry i cannot buy in .

no soy muy amante del shoegaze pero hay que reconocer que esta es el mejor album del movimiento. se denota melodia y sentimiento debajo de este manto de ruido... en el coche he tenido que cortar la musica un par de veces pensando que tenia una averia...

loveless is one of the few examples where you can call an album beautiful in a literal way. the biggest mistake you can make is to try to judge it for individual songs the album never been about that i always look at it as some kind of a session a feeling a whole... when you look at it as a composition of dreamy sounds that make everything in your head look like that pink cover you will get it...
there are some incredible songs on this album and there are some unbearable ones too.
i liked the first song and then they kept repeating it over and over and over and over...with more noise each time. finally i got sick of it and started fast-forwarding. to each their own.

i have done a fair amount of musical experimentation myself along the way and i have not been afraid to break out some incredible delay and droning feedback here and there. there have been times when i have put together a wall of sound so devious it would send packs of wolves whining into the night. the difference is that i never had the gall to try to release such explorations. now i suppose this can be looked at one of two ways. one perhaps i have missed out on an excellent opportunity to release an album that would be looked back upon years later as an undisputed classic one that could be considered a launching pad for a thousand dreamy nights and the seed for a whole series of musical revolutions. or two i have done the world a service by not unleashing such raucous offerings upon the public at large. i will decline to pick a side. but what must be said is that if i experimented with such sounds in the years before this album was released i likely was not the only one. the rest of us just were not geniusvindictive enough to carry it beyond our own 4 walls.
why the hell this album is so well-rated? i am tolerant open-minded and stuff but come on. i just do not get it.

there i listened to it. and?... now do not get me wrong. i am not implying that this is a bad album or anything. but a 4.2 score is certainly not justified 4.2 being the reason i checked this out. it is a pretty good dream pop album but it is nothing spectacular and does not have anything that makes it stand out from other albums by groups like lush cranes heart throbs etc.

this was a big disapointment - i expected it to be way better considering the rating here. this is an ok album completely inoffensive and extremely consistent but it really drags after a while and nothing on this grabs me at all. i suppose the guitars are well done - the layers of guitar create a droning effect that sounds cool but does not really give much musical or emotional impact to the songs. in fact the album sounds way too homogenous - you have got virtually the same droning multi-layered guitar sounds pretty much non-stop for 45 minutes. this actually gets really nerve-racking after a while and i have to turn it off - i think i have only made it throught the whole album once. it is particularly annoying through headphones. would have been much better if they had varied the approach a little. also the singing is mediocre mixed way too low and adds little or nothing to the songs. i have no idea what any of the lyrics are - i think i could identify one actual word over the entire album. this might be an incredible acheivement in terms of sound engineeringrecording and guitar technique but it is only decent mood music at best. the smashing pumpkins took essentially the same sound but made much more out of it in the mid-nineties.

not sure quite what i was expecting here - but i was thoroughly bored. the dissonant sections just sound like standard 90s dance music drownd in thin noise. the lighter sections just sound like standard 90s dance music but moany. certain pieces verged on the quite listenable but not enough of it rose above average for it is lofty critical perch.

what to say about loveless... well the guitars are awesome. really beautifully crafted work of genius. the vocals are preposterous that bitch cannot sing for good and her voice is pretty annoying. the drums are not bad but mixed far too much behind. the overall mastering is bad. i would still give it 610.

i thought that i would like the album way more than i did. i loved the first jesus and mary chain and i was thinking that this would be something similar. it kind of is but not really. i did not like the first four songs so things did not bode well for the rest of the album but i ended up enjoin six of the last seven songs. as long as you can deal with the beautiful melodies being drowned by layers of distorted guitar and what not you will like this album. the standout tracks start with when you sleep i only said  and come in alone. the rest of the outstanding songs are sometimes what you want and soon. if you enjoy shoegaze music i highly recommend this album. there are a lot of great melodies hidden behind the wall of noise. check this out!

considerably boring and monotonous which says a lot coming from someone who can easily enjoy lustmord. i have enjoyed sometimes since the first time i heard it years ago but the rest of the album falls incredibly short in comparison and only occasionally shows off sparks of interesting possibilities that end up dissipating into shreds of disappointment. overrated and undeserving of it is relentless hipster praise does not even cut it when trying to speak about this album.

cuando no se tiene mucha idea de msica o se tiene el talento de un marc bolan o unos ramones o casi que es mejor dejarlo. pero claro tambin est la va alternativa de aprovecharse del ramalazo pedante de algunos y parir porqueras como sta. por lo visto estos mindundis a falta de un mnimo talento para la composicin se dedicaron aqu a superponer capas y capas de sonido -a saber en qu momento decidieron parar y por qu razn- y a aadirles la voz de un meningtico recin levantado. la intencin no era otra que hacer algo fresco y novedoso como dictaban los cnones de la prensa musical y dems esnobs de parvulario y la cosa como es lgico les sali redonda. una simplonada como un templo. lo suyo es que se hubiesen quedado mezclando y superponiendo capas de sonido ad eternum y que este pedazo de mierda no hubiese visto nunca la luz.

i get the appeal. i can see why people likeloveenjoy it. 7 all time seems a bit crazy to me but still this record is widely considered a classic and i am good with it. all in all it is not for me. i revisit once a year or so to see if it clicks. i appreciate the guitarsdense production. that is about it. it is ok. if you do not like only shallow nothing going forward is going to be enjoyable. to here knows when is the only thing i skip every time. the rest is decent to me nothing special.
attuned overrated noise.
good overall mood and some great songs overall though it does not hit me like it does some.

i have softened my views on this album but i still do not fully get it i reckon. it is certainly a nice mix of melody and noise but shoegaze is general is a genre i have tended to dislike. now being widely considered best in something i usually do not like might negate some of the negative feeling but i still do not love this. rating changed from 3.0 to 3.5 on 122321 favorite tracks only shallow when you sleep sometimes
i do not get it.

the seminal shoegaze band whose style has influenced the smashing pumpkins and other grunge luminaries with their heavy use of feedback and droning ethereal vocals. an easy album to admire but not to adore at least from my point of view. it may grow on me but it all sounds like one song to me. the vocals just seemed to be drowned out by the noise which makes me feel nauseous.

it is a gorgeous album for sure pleasantly disorienting in a way that few others are... but uninteresting once one has became adjusted to its unique sound because there is little depth beside that dreamy sound itself - not in melody lyrics or other instrumentation - to discover or appreciate.

i must say that i have underrated this critically acclaimed classic. but if i must try to save myself here i must say that i would say it the highest 3 and half stars that i possibly could. i find the potential here to range past five stars but i still regardlessly find the album a bit of an anachronism and in that i am unable to fully connect in a way that i would otherwise with another album. i always find it hard to discern whether something is great because it precedes something or whether its great because its truly great. i asked myself this question about loveless and what i found was well... sort of. maybe when i re ask myself in the future i will have a new answer but for now i find the album to hold truly worthwhile content especially for having been created before i was even born.

an album that takes the sonic fuzz experimentation of the velvet underground in the 60s and the jesus and mary chain in the 80s and makes the genres statement for the 90s. hugely textured and unique but searing on the ears.

i tried very hard to like this album more than i did and while i certainly found it engaging as an overall listen i could not overlook the large patches of noise that had no melodic backbone. as a result i was left wondering why this album has left such a legacy in its wake not because it is not influential but because sooo many people cite it as groundbreaking. i will admit however that when my bloody valentine combines noise rock with hook-driven melody as on tracks like when you sleep and sometimes the results are astounding. i will also admit if you consider smashing pumpkins an essential 90s band then yes this album is groundbreaking in many ways since it is to billy corgan what the pixies were to rivers cuomo and maybe kurt cobain too.
most likely the most overrated album ever...

um lbum sobrevalorizado pelos ecos nostlgicos do presente que fica a dever muito ao seu antecessor is not anything. gostei muito de when you sleep mas o resto fica muito aqum them termos de qualidade.

before i start this review i have to tell you that i have very ambivalent feelings about shoegaze in general. it can be absolutely brilliant if the musicians can actually write songs but it can also be the easy way for not-so-good musicians. you can be a completely amateur guitar player who knows about three chords all you need is some distortion pedals and a squealing woman and there you go. your woman does not even need to sing well because putting some echo effect on her voice during production and mastering will make it sound good and different anyway. i am not saying that this is the exact case with my bloody valentine but i feel like it is a bit true for them as well. i mean for the first 4 tracks on loveless i kind of felt like i was listening to a very old washing machine doing its very last tumble drying it is pretty much like some guys going to a practice room and just playing around with their distortion pedals without making any sense. when you sleep is finally a real song the only song i actually liked on this album and after it the album gets okay all the other tracks are actual songs and not just making noise but still they are songs that i do not like. i have also noticed that most of the better songs are sung by kevin shields so it kind of feels like he gave his weaker ones to bilinda to sing but that might just be my thinking maybe i have met too many aholes with too much ego and i keep seeing them everywhere. still even though all that i have written here are from my very subjective point of view i just still do not feel like this album would be such an essential thing from an objective point of view. the sound and production is very good but other than that i honestly do not understand all the hype because the way it sounds it is just the garnish and the actual content is not that good. therefore i just cannot rate it any better than 25 stars.
the best noise i have ever heard.

i will admit that beyond it is utterly lifeless shapeless composure lies some sort of mysterious hidden glint which probably gives it the popularity on a site that promotes the deep over the easily digested. however for someone who has no real desire to give such a monotonous album 772 listens it just falls into the rest of their discography trashy uninspired shoegaze.

i really like the powerful groove of only shallow and ethereal beauty of what you want but the rest of the record seems too boring as for my ears. yes i understand how ifluental and acclaimed this record is but i measure music with my feelings not with histirical meaning of record or number of five-star reviews on this site. one day i will definitely return to loveless but now only two and a half stars.

i can see why people who listened to this as a teenager love this album. it brims with melancholy. but hearing it for the first time as an adult i do not find it that interesting. the drone effect had been done before see velvet underground. if this is the first album to blend droning fuzz guitar with catchy upbeat melodies then it has some historical value. but early smashing pumpkins did it better and more interestingly. a track or two at a time is enjoyable but the album as a whole is too repetitive.

i ordered this because of all the accolades i have read on here similar to the reason why i wanted to hear televisions marquee moon. i got to say i cannot believe anyone likes this crap or can call it music. i cannot understand a single vocal all the way through this thing and outside of the guitar riff in only shallow i hear almost no music just a bunch of feedback and fuzz. in the same vein of sonic youth this is music for people who cannot play instruments and just give you feedback like a motherfucker and call it art. probably the most overrated album on this entire website. i do not know that an album has ever dissapointed me more than this collosal piece of shit. i am going to make a note to disregard the opinions of the people who like this album

really bad- not my cup of tea. this album sounds like a bunch of noise that goes nowhere. you cannot hear one word of the vocals but that was done on purpose. on the other hand the melodies can be heard through all of the garbage.
unique mix of noise and melody. but something is different from my taste. is not this too sweet especially lyrics?

i find the record worth alone for sometimes. i like only swallow a lot as well and most of the songs to be honest. it might not be your favorite record but it has something to offer i believe. sometimes is definitely the peak of this album.
vocals are fucking awful... but music is decent. i think this album is overrated. 90s music have better bands...

despite its acclaim and influence this fails to take advantage of the shoegaze sound in the way that its followers were able to. it has all the aesthetics that laid the groundwork for shoegaze extensive use of pedal effects dreamy wall of sound etc but it adheres to poppy song structures far too much. just about the only thing that can be appreciated about this album is its influence. if you want to hear shoegaze being achieved to its full potential you will find it in most of the other pioneering bands more so than this bland album.

i had written a review of this which wondered to what degree the reason for its supposed greatness was the way everything was tightly edited together leaving no gaps. i wondered if a quick fiddle to make it sound less like a radio 1 breakfast show might considerably reduce the albums stature and i thought but did not say that if an album could be reduced so easily it perhaps was not much of an album to start with. thinking about this now though it seems a clearly ludicrous line of thought. the album is about immersion asking for gaps between tracks is like asking rothko to paint miniatures. i wish to acknowledge this error. i also wish to state that while i do not think there can be any reasonable doubt that mbvs best song is you made me realise loveless contains many fine things which i am sure are detailed quite adequately in reviews on this website and elsewhere. but i wish to further state that it is a record you live with and i have not. still.
one day...

the whole of loveless has a fuzzy washed out sound seemingly tailor-made for closing eyes and getting lost inside of. when you sleep has a few hooks but by-and-large the foundation of the loveless journey is this fuzzy hypnotic dreamscape that slowly ambles forth. the lyrics are buried so deeply down inside the fuzz that they are almost inaudible the fragile vocals of shields seem like a ghost or something trying to shimmer out and communicate from the netherworld through all the warbling. you could say that if anything it is just a bit overcooked with all this additive buzzy sound but as the album gets into side b this load lightens. from come in alone which floats away in a kind of divine head-swimming trance the songs become much more cushioned and dreamy. the sighing hush of vocals across the grating buzz in sometimes harks forward to smashing pumpkins quite possibly an influence on billy corgan. the warbled wispy and airy blown a wish gets balanced up by the slightly noisier what you want and soon but the vocal remains ghostly and fragile. the sound of loveless is all about the ebb and flow of that weirdly distorted ambiance the building and building of that warm glowing fuzzwash of guitar and shrieky noise that rises and falls throughout. layer upon layer of sampled bits are overlaid sounding something like a hundred broken tape recorders groaning around and around while buzzed-out guitars drone over the top and dainty vocals coo through the middle. since it is submerged under so many layers of electric pack-makeup i do understand why some people just do not get loveless. it tends to get lost within itself and meanders over and over as though in a trance. i confess it took a long time for me to get it just one day without warning it just clicked and i started to sway internally and glaze-out. the success of this for you the listener probably requires you to be in right the mood for glazing out to its distorted hypnosis but the perseverance is rewarded.
what is the big deal? it sounds like the pixies but highly overproduced. the noise drones go on too long and the vocals are mediocre. it is a lot like film incidental music run amok.

very over-rated album.. for me it seems like a mess of sounds and i could barely hear some songs with my earphones without getting irritated. the only good thing about this album is that i think it influenced a lot of bands like m83 and other indie acts which perfected the style and they sound way better and freshier than this noisy band.
more tuneful than i imagined it would be. although i cannot say i love it and some of the tracks disappear in the fuzziness i do like songs like only shallow and when you sleep.

i hear steve urkels annoying fucking dinosaur slippers in the first track i must be losing it. not a bad album really but not what i am into at the moment. i will just take your words that its the greatest album ever made in all of eternity. whatever.....

giving another view of how noise can penetrate into pop structurethe perfectionist kevin shields found the way to bend his guitars and the atmosphere around him with this great record a fine example of sound exploration.
at first i was like  but then... i was still like

it just gets old. it is highly original. lo-fi noise and shoegaze with indiscernable vocals. slosh pop. literally sounds like somebody got way too messed up and then went into the studio. i would love to hear this record with a slightly more straightforward mix just to compare. i will take lush- gala over this any day. closing track is amazing however!

8 listens in i just do not get it. it is vaguely pleasant music mostly but i see nothing here that screams 5 stars nothing here that says listen to me and not one of many other albums that exist. maybe i just need to listen to it high.

loveless mag musikhistorisch von groer relevanz sein und tatschlich prgten sie das genre shoegaze markant slowdive aber brauchen bei ihrem zwei jahre spter produziertem souvlaki keine groen umschweife um my bloody valentine in den schatten zu stellen. sehr viel krawall und liberale geruschkulissen finden sich auf loveless aber zu welchem zweck? quirlige dissonanz betubt die ohren dahinter verbirgt sich eine sehr seichte langweilige nachricht. to here knows when zum beispiel bedient sich an einer wand die aus lautstrke und undefinierbarem krach besteht. die elemente passen nicht zusammen und klar mssen sie auch nicht aber hier ist das entdecken de weil es nichts zu entdecken gibt. ich wnschte die band wre hier von ihrem verwaschenen kauderwelsch abgewichen denn loomer und insbesondere when you sleep legen hervorragende anstze zu tage. das konstrukt ist geheimnisvoll das flimmern und rauschen ldt ein den verborgenen kern zu suchen. beim rest gilt potential leider vergeudet.
boring overrated.

i am sorry to interrupt your 5 star festival in here but i do not like this album. maybe i am taking the wrong drugs maybe i had the wrong girlfriends maybe i just do not know good music. but 25 stars nonetheless officially revisited 31.may 2013  25 -- 25 still not feeling it

not the best album of 1991 by a longshot but a good album indeed. this is one of those albums that is about half great and half boring. when the band develop strong melodies to go along with the unique atmosphere they create the results are great. unfortunately about half of the tracks seem to lack a strong melody to carry them and without the melody they just become sort of aimless and boring. highlights only shallow when you sleep come in alone i only said sometimes.

loveless gibt als ganzes ein recht erbrmliches bild ab. gewiss einige passagen wirken weniger strend als andere. vor allem dann wenn die langeweile durch totalausflle wie das unglaublich nervige when you sleep unterbrochen wird und man sich hinterher an der formlosigkeit des nchsten songs erfreuen kann. der jmmerliche gesang sowie eine produktion die angeblich unwahrscheinlich aufwndig sein soll schlussendlich aber einfach in hhenlastiges rauschen mndet stehen jedem hrvergngen i am wege. der entscheidende punkt ist aber dass die songs einfach nicht gut sind. dazu kommt noch diese leck-mich-am-arsch-attitde die scheinbar in den 90ern so angesagt war auf mich aber eher peinlich wirkt. my bloody valentine geben sich sehr viel mhe um desinteressiert zu wirken. leider ist es nicht so dass sie diesen widerspruch auch nur ansatzweise in irgendetwas spannendes ummnzen knnten.

all too often this is the only shoegaze album some people own and more often still this is talked up as the definitive shoegaze release. bollocks to both. what is good about this album? well it is got the gaze. if you want to hear the sound of people staring far too intently at effects pedals and making the sound from their guitars swirl in all kinds of maddening directions this has the goods. it is got pleasant melodies captured in a vortex of haze and distortion so you cannot go too far wrong. what is not so good? well as much as sheilds tried the productions a bit underwhelming and turns the swirly gaze into more of a formless mush than entrancing waves of guitar noises. plus some of the songs just are not that good. simple as that. it goes on too long for what it is. in essence loveless is the sound of people with not a lot to say and too many effects pedals with which to say it. personally i think it is a terrible shame this decent and enjoyable but flawed album is held up as the finest shoegaze album instead of nowhere by ride or shot forth self living by medicine. if you want to know how good the gaze can be grab nowhere or shot forth self living.

oh how i was once excited for this album. i remember it clearly hearing the background story reading up on the record and then acquiring a copy though rather strangely for me i do not remember where from. listening to it.. actually at first i thought my excitement was well justified with the first loping riff of only shallow and everything it brought with it i was hopeful of having really found a new favourite and not having just been suckered in by an interesting story. i think this enthusiasm even persisted dimly through loomer and touched before to here knows when kicked me in the literal nuts and stole my proverbial dinner money. i know the objection to the line i am toeing here - that i do not get it. i will be the first to admit that yes i do not get it. i love cacophonous music i love absurd guitar noise i love slow and hazy song structures i seem to love everything that is in loveless only loveless is rubbish. i am listening to it right now - my one-last-listen-before-reviewing - and i really cannot wait for it to be over. partly because it is much the same mess that bored me near to tears last time i gave it a chance and partly because i know that the latter half of soon will again be the only part of the record beyond the opening track i find slightly likable. there is a lot i like about loveless - the relentless attention to detail utter artistic absorption the refusal of compromise and the dedication to massive guitars - but unfortunately the music itself is not a part of it.

so you add layers of noise to some catchy love songs the result is an all-time guitar classic right? the color is part black part pink i only care about the pinkcatchy part sing the lyrics as though they were by coldplay. but the noisedark part of this album also touches my isolated heart sometimes. to here knows when was often heard on radio which introduced and accustomed me to the blurry soundscape. warning if you relate a lot to this music find it unbelievably beautiful then you are in trouble you must really be loveless.
this album really only deserves  but gets a bonus  for inspiring billy corgan. it is easy to hear the influence on the pumpkins it is also easy to hear how important execution is.
there has never been an album more overrated than this one in the history of rym. that said it is a good album. ...just not 4.22 good. jesus.
i like this.
what happened? i used to like this album a lot. now i just think it is mostly quite bland with some good bits here and there. oddly though you made me realise-ep still works wonders on me.

i have never been a huge my bloody valentine fan. i mean i understand their place in musical history and i obviously appreciate the fact that they basically invented shoegaze but i have always thought that you do not necessarily have to like a band to appreciate what they have done. there is clearly no doubt how influential this album is but i cannot really say that it is an album that i find myself listening to very often. the album definitely has it is good moments. opener only shallow is definitely a highlight as is when you sleep sometimes blown a wish and album closer soon. then there are songs such as to here knows when i only said and what you want that just seem to meander on and on without actually doing anything interesting. the album has definitely grown on me in recent years which is why i hesitated to rate for so long. about a year ago i probably would have rated it a 2.5 or a low 3 but i think it is grown on me enough to earn a solid 3.5. overall a cool album that is earned it is place in music history but just not an album that is as great as it is significance suggests. not to mention that i actually think i like is not anything a tad more.
ok then i will give it 25 stars although my ears would say 2... i honestly do not understand why people love this album so much...

how i hate myself for not liking this record! god i really tried! 1991 was such a great year in pop music. nirvanas nevermind talk talks laughing stock rhcps bloodsugarsexmagik sepulturas arise soundgardens badmotorfinger massive attacks blue lines primal screams screamadelica crowded houses woodface mr. bungles debut teenage fanclubs bandwagonesque matthew sweets girlfriend prongs prove you wrong... i could go on and i love them all. but this one simply does not click for me as open as i am to experimental sounds. while hearing it you get the feeling that a vinyl record is playing and someone puts a finger on it from time to time in order to slow it down. it seems that almost everybody loves the idea but to me it is simply annoying. however the album opens with what i consider one of the best singles of all times - the gloriously beautiful only shallow. that is what forces me to give the album one solitary and shining star. sorry everybody.
a disappointment. excellent songs hampered by a terrible mix and tedious tape-speed wankery.
a great mellow album with walls and walls of textured guitar sounds in such a spacey serene atmosphere. with amazing subdued vocals. one of my favorite shoegaze albums

another grower it would appear. though it has taken a painfully long time for the rating to climb to three stars. still too many moments that put me off but coming back to it over the years has paid dividends in some unexpected places. give it another decade or so and we might have a genuine five star article on our hands.
good work but a bit overrated some tracks are redundant and the best songs sounds like the cocteau twins reworked with studio tricks.

this album is certainly full of great texture and effects. it is that and the layered sound that usually garners this album praise. but it is not layered at all! there is always a distinct sound up in the front dominating all the others. and the sound that is in the front of the mix is usually repeated umpteen times lessening the impact of the noise and potential beauty.
